column5: [DKS] a ‘I’, KI50.31-2 a.. .aysä.. .tsīme '1 go’, to aysu, aysä.
[DKS] ‘not’, Av. a-, an-, IE Pok. 756ne. See s.vv. a-, and. i-, with āhvaraa- ‘sour’; K 101-39 i’īsedai ‘not returning’.
[DKS] ‘not’, Av. a-, an-, IE Pok. 756ne. See s.vv. a-, and. i-, with āhvaraa- ‘sour’; K 101-39 i’īsedai ‘not returning’.
[DKS] ‘not’, Av. a-, an-, IE Pok. 756ne. See s.vv. a-, and. i-, with āhvaraa- ‘sour’; K 101-39 i’īsedai ‘not returning’.

[DKS] ‘not’, Av. a-, an-, IE Pok. 756ne. See s.vv. a-, and. i-, with āhvaraa- ‘sour’; K 101-39 i’īsedai ‘not returning’.
[DKS] ‘not’, Av. a-, an-, IE Pok. 756ne. See s.vv. a-, and. i-, with āhvaraa- ‘sour’; K 101-39 i’īsedai ‘not returning’.
[DKS] ‘not self’, Manj. 390, variant 29-14 anätma; Manj. 323 a-uysānai, abstract v 103, 19V3 a-uysānetä.

[DKS] ‘unskilled.’, iv 3, 6-7 u caṃdä va vāri star<ä> da<ṃ>di akalāśca hīri yuḍai ‘and. as to how many are the shares, so unskilfully you have acted.’; iv 3.8-9 ttadī <daṃdi> akalāścauñä ya ‘it was only through such lack of skill’. See kala- ‘excellent’.

[DKS] ‘unattached’, Bcd 48V2, BS asakta-; Bcd 52r3, BS asanga-, to kaṣṭa-.
[SVK] ‘unattached’ (Dict, la): misprint for akaṣṭa-.

[DKS] ‘not thinking’, dyadic v 131, 56a1 amañāmata ak’āmate jsa.
[SVK] ‘inconceivable’ (Diet, 1a): for the variant spelling ayāṣṭa- see s.v. bāysania-.
[DKS] ‘inconceivable’, K 53.10.10, with agāṣṭa-, avāṣṭa-, āīṭa-, to käṣ-: kāsṭa-’, BS acintiya-.
[DKS] ‘shameless’, Ⅲ 123.52, BS nirlajja-; abstr. akṣārmauña ‘lack of shame’, Manj. 67 akṣārmauña apakṣarāttai, to kṣär-: kṣāḍa-.
[DKS] ‘unmoved’, Bcd 56v2, Bcd 55v1, BS adhṛṣya-, with akhāṃṣṭa-, akhāṣṭa-, Manj. 368 akhvauṣṭa-, to khoys-: khauṣṭa-.

[DKS] ‘undisturbed’, SuvO. 4r4, BS akṣobhya-, to khvīh- ‘to agitate’.
[SVK] The passage from SuvO. 4r4 KT 1.233 runs as follows: [Suv 1.3] diśvo" tcūruvo’ balysyau atiṣṭhānyau ayäṣṭhātä vāstātā akhvīhānau. Akṣubhyā sarbandä hāle etc. corresponding to Skt (Nobel p. 2) dikṣu catasṛṣu buddhair adhiṣṭhāna-m-adhiṣṭtitam/Akṣobhyarājaḥ pūrvasmin ‘sustained through divine support by the Buddhas in the four directions: Akṣobhyarāja in the East’. (I have read °rājahḥ. nominative, with the Skt manuscripts ABCDE, the Tibetan and the Khotanese, against Nobel’s instrumental.)
In KT 6.64 Bailey renders akhvīhānau. Akṣubhyä sarbandā hāle, as ‘the eastern region of Akṣobhya, the immovable’ and a similar rendering is probably implied in Dict. s. v. khvīh-, where Bailey has ‘akhvīhānau, akṣubhyā “Akṣobhya unshakable”’ (cf. also jSGS 27 s. v. khvīh-: ‘the dyadic expression akhvīhānau akṣubhyä’). Such an interpretation of akhvīhānau is unlikely in view of the discrepancy in form between the two words: Akṣubhyā is nominative sg. masculine, akhvīhānau either nominative-accusative sg. neuter, or accusative sg. masculine. (Note that in this manuscript, SuvO., the noun endings are used correctly with only one or two exceptions. It does not show the incipient confusion of -ä and -u which is found in some Old Khotanese texts, e. g. Z, cf. SGS 253 (v) and 254—5 (iii) —(iv).) [Skjsærvø, I, p.13]
[DKS] ‘inconstant (?)’, epithet of lovers, 11 130b1 agṣṭau brrau jsa īnīda ‘ they act with violence towards the inconstant (?) lovers’, to akaṣṭa-.

[DKS] ‘unpolluted’, K 152.10 jñāna-pārāma. . .vasva adū agūm pā’ darma-vajrrą, ‘the knowledge-perfection pure, undimmed, unpolluted, clear, the Dharma-vajra’ from *gauna- or *guna- ‘pollution’, to gū, -ūha- ‘ excreta’, Av. gūθa-, IE Pok. 4S3-5 gụōu-: gụū- in a tetradic phrase; O.Ind. gūna- ‘defecated’, cognates s.v. gū.
[DKS] ‘ markless ’, v 131, ib2 ṣä aggūnaigya tcalca ‘ the boundary without mark’.
[DKS] ‘not quarrelling’, v Ⅲ, 33VI, BS avivāda-, togūrāsa-.
[DKS] ‘invincible’, K 26.140 aguhasta tta tta khu nārāya jasta ‘invincible like the deva-god Nārāyaṇa’, K35.86 agvihasti, K39.153 agūhasta, K18.214 agvehasta, =BS durdharṣa-, to guhei.
[DKS] ‘not injuring’, K 7, 14815, = BS aparihāṇi-, Tib. mi ñams-pa, to gauda-.
[DKS] ‘indigestion’, Sid. 8r4, BS āma-; Z 13.104 inst. sing, agvahäna, from *vipaχθa- or *vipaχa- to pak-, gvach-, paha-, pajs-.

[DKS] ‘limb’, Sid.2v4; Sid. 128v4 aga-, from ang-‘ to bend’, in Av. anura- of zairimyanura- ‘with covered limbs’ epithet of the tortoise; to haṃguṣṭa-, Oss. D. iuong, jong, I. uāng, uong, ong, plur. uängtä ‘limb’ (from *vivanga- or secondary iu-, j-, u-). Zor.P. zarimangur has -ng- for Av. -n-. The BS loan-word is in aṃga-prattyaṃga v 327a3. See agalaka, s.v. aśa’ulaka.

[DKS] ‘asa fetida’, Ⅲ 89.165; Sid. 1ov1, BS hingu-, Sid. 12v4 aṃgūṣḍa-, Sid. 122r3 agūṣḍạ-, from *angu-jatu- (BSOAS2o,1957,50-2), TokharaB aṅkwaṣ, Uigur 'nk’pwš, Chinese a-uei <â-ngjwei; iang-kuei ‹ iang-g’jwi (KⅠ.Ⅰ; 1307.1; and K 210.1; 457.1), see BSOAS Ⅱ.786, and E. Pulleyblank, AM, n.s., 9,1962, 99 for the final -s. West Iranian Armen, lw. angoužat, angžat, angoužataber‘bearing silphium, N.Pers. angužad, angudān, anguyān. From *angu-ǰatu- withǰatu- ‘gum, resin’, Pašto žāwla, O.Ind. jatu-, jatu-vāra- (JRAS 1955,17-18), N.Pers. žad ‘gum’. IE Pok. 480 gųet-. For the variation of Iranian angu- and O.Ind. hingu-, note also the O.Ind. andola- and hindola- ' swing’. The plant belongs to the dry Iranian region.

[DKS] ‘she sewed’, K46.49 ba khauysa byāṃdā u acā u ttu vajsya avījsyadai purakä ñūṣṭyā ‘ she found a small piece of cloth and she sewed and wrapped it round her afflicted blind son’. To ācana ‘ thread, BS sūtra-’. Base čai-: či-, with acā from *ačitātä and ācana from *ā-čyana-. With č-> ž-, M.Pers.T. ’bzyngr, M.Parth.T. ’bjyn'gr ‘ tailor’, N.Pers. āžīdan, āžadan, āžandan ‘to sew’; with kai-:ki- in Sogd. kyn'k ‘sword’, O.Pers.άκινάκης, O.Ind. kīnāśa- ‘plough_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x001F_man’ (TPS 1955, 67-69), adding BS cīmara- ‘metal, iron or copper’, to IE Pok. 917 (s)k(h)ai- ‘to cut, pierce’. For ‘ thread’ derived from ‘to sew’, note O.Ind. sīvyati, syūta, sūtra-. For acā, see also pacā 'she covered’ from *pa(ti)- čatātä, pres, pacan-. See also mejanya- ‘embroidery (?)’. N.Pers. žanah ‘sting (of insect), point (of needle)’,

[DKS] ‘undestroyed, not perished’, K107.285; K108.303 ajya, Manj. 2 obliq. aje, plural K 69, 2v1 ajau, K 66.138 ajāṃ; in the phrase ahamya- ajya- ‘ not produced, not perished’ the participle to the nominal phrase K 53.9.2-3 hamāme jiṃgya jsa, = BS utpāda-nirodha-. The -jya, -ja is from jäta-, jita-, participle to jin- ‘to perish’.
[DKS] ‘imperishable, inexhaustible’, v 171, 303b4; Bcd 44v2 ajānaa-, BS akṣaya-; Bcd 50r2 fem. ajāṃja pājęñä, BS akṣaya-kośah, to jai-: ji-. pres. jin-.

[DKS] ‘to pursue’, Ⅰ plur. Ⅱ 45.67; 46.89 ajsāṃ ( VI 376; BSOAS 15, 1953, 537-8) to O.Pers. haǰ-, O.Ind. sájati, saktá- ‘cling to’, with zga- in Av. spā vohunazgō ‘the dog pursuing blood’, with lost h- (IE Pok. SS7-S seg-). See āysagamu, and pahej-.
[SGS] ‘to pursue’ ? I b
1pl. pres. act. or mid., L.Kh.: ajsāṃ Ch 00269. 67, 89 KT 2. 45, 46.
Et. Cf. OP haǰ-, O.Ind. saj-, H. W. B., BSOAS, xv. 3, 1953, 537. [p.5]
[DKS] ‘not struck’, III75.235 hamye vara ṣṭana ajsa ‘he was there unharmed' JS 36VI peṃ ajse ‘unbroken force’, to jsata- ‘struck’, base gan-: jata-.

[DKS] ‘undeceivable’, K4,141r4, Tib. slu-bar mi mdzad-pa; SuvO. 54V1, BS avisaṃvādanā, to jsīr- : jsīḍa- ‘ to cheat ’.
[SVK] This word means ‘undeceiving’ (active), not ‘undeceivable’ (passive). Note that at Dict. 115 s. v. jsīr- Bailey also translates actively ‘without deception’, deriving it from jsīraṇa- ‘deceitful, deceptive’.
SuvO. 54vl KT1.238 [Suv 8.53] has ajs[ī]rana ttätä pata ‘those spells (pada) are undeceiving’, Skt (Nobel p. 117) avisaṃvādanārtha-padā ‘the words whose meaning cannot deceive’ (Emmerick, SGL 50).
The suffix -ana- is never used to form adjectives with passive meaning, cf. tcārana- ‘able, capable’, (an)eṣṭavana- ‘(un)enduring’, (a)hovana- ‘powerful/weak’.[Skjsærvø, I, p.14]

[DKS] ‘desirable’, V115, 6417 bryau ajseryau jsa, BS iṣṭa-; Z 24.438 ttädrä näśtä ajserä panye uysnorä kho brī jīvätäd ‘there is not a desired thing to any being like dear life’, to a base gar- ‘to value’ or ‘ abuse’. The -js- derives from either -js- or -tc- intervocalic. See ggīraa- and pajarūṇa-.

[DKS] ‘other ’, K 4, 141r5 ka aysu aña hvāñiñi ‘ if I may speak other things’, Tib. gžan-du smra-bagyur-na, III 25, 27a3 ni aña ‘not the reverse’, BS ananyathā-vādī ‘speaking otherwise’; repeated K 51.6.3 añä añä, K 49.3.8 añi añi thāna‘ various other places’, to anya-, Av. ainya-, O.Pers. aniya-, Sogd. ’ny, Yaγn. ane, ani, M.Parth., M.Pers.T. ’ny, Iškāšmī an, Waxī, Sarīkolī yan, Oss. innä, annā, IE Pok. 37 an-, anio-. Derivatives are SuvO. 68r7~68VI hastamo añänāmo, BS parame viśiṣte, Z 4.54 añärāmä ‘other’; añadrāmā, dyadic VS3, I3V4 añädrrāmyau haṃdaryau, Manj. 195 husadā aysmva brrā añadrrāmā haudvyau naiśta (see s.v. hus-); K 54, 15r4 rrų̄ ttūśā ni va añadrāmā näśtä, K 54, 15r4 añadrrāmā, K55, 16r1 añadrāmā naiśtā, III104.27-8 tta añarrva brraṣti ‘so he asked other things (?)’.

[DKS] ‘ill-luck’, III 15.35 hāysai añai hime ‘for him ill-luck becomes remote’; III 15.43 hāysai śaṃda añai hime ‘for him ill-luck arises in a remote place’ (so improving on BSOS 8, 1937, 926-7). Hence *anaya-ka- to *anyaa~, añaa- to base nai- ‘be lively, bright, fortunate’, in O.Pers. naiba- ‘excellent’, Zor.P. nēv, nēvak, nēvakōk ‘good, fortunate ’, Oss. D. nivä, I. nyv ‘ good fortune’, M.Parth.T. nys’g (*nai-s-) ‘bright’ to IE Pok. 760 nei-:ni-, Lat. niteō, ‘shine’, Celtic O.Ir. noīb ‘holy’. To this source can be traced also BS, Pali anaya- ‘misfortune’. Note loss of interior -a-, as in gyasta- < *yazata-.

[DKS] ‘not deficient; equipped with’, Manj. III usp(u)rra edrra jsa añasta ‘complete, possessing the faculties’ (BS indriya-); =BS avikalendriya-, K 30.207 aidrrau jsa añaṣṭa, variant K 38.141-2 adrryāṃ jsi ukhsastä (read: uskhastä), to nyaśś- ‘be weak, poor, deficient’.

[DKS] ‘other’, III 73.178; 71.132; 74.194 aḍä, shortened from aḍara- (as pharu, pka); loc. sing, IV 22.3.13 aḍaña māśta ‘another month’, III 72.155 tta ttai dyāṃdä aḍa vā daitte ‘so they saw him, the other (=the enemy) is seen’,
[SVK] aḍa ‘other’ (Dict.) ; adara- ‘other’ (Dict.) aḍari ‘vehicle’ (Dict.)
These three entries appear to involve a single word aḍara- ‘that, yon’, aḍa is just a reduced form of aḍara- as pointed out by Bailey. That aḍara- means ‘that’ should have been clear from the LKh. rendering of Z5.77 ttū padandaimä u ttāru ‘I have created this and that’ by ttu *padedaima tta vā aḍara in Mañj 234 KBT 124, where ttāru corresponds to aḍara. In Hed. 3.13 KT4.22 there also seems to be a contrast between ttiña māśta ‘in this month’ and aḍaña māśta ‘in that month’. The remaining passages cited in the Dict. are from the Rāma story (KT 3.65—76). Some of them leave no room for doubt concerning the meaning of aḍa(ra).[Emmerick, II, p.14]

[DKS] ‘other’, III 76.55-6 aḍarä ye cvāṃ pyaṃtsa ā ‘there was another who came before them’; III 69.103 aḍarä vā gīhyarä jse ‘do you help to kill the other one’; Manj. 234 tin (pade)daima tta vā aḍara, variant Z 5.77 ttū padandaimä u ttāru ‘this I have created and the other (variant: that one) ’. From *ar-tara- to IE Pok. 25 al-tera Lat. alter.
[SVK] aḍa ‘other’ (Dict.) ; adara- ‘other’ (Dict.) aḍari ‘vehicle’ (Dict.)
These three entries appear to involve a single word aḍara- ‘that, yon’, aḍa is just a reduced form of aḍara- as pointed out by Bailey. That aḍara- means ‘that’ should have been clear from the LKh. rendering of Z5.77 ttū padandaimä u ttāru ‘I have created this and that’ by ttu *padedaima tta vā aḍara in Mañj 234 KBT 124, where ttāru corresponds to aḍara. In Hed. 3.13 KT4.22 there also seems to be a contrast between ttiña māśta ‘in this month’ and aḍaña māśta ‘in that month’. The remaining passages cited in the Dict. are from the Rāma story (KT 3.65—76). Some of them leave no room for doubt concerning the meaning of aḍa(ra).[Emmerick, II, p.14]

[DKS] ‘vehicle’, Z 24.120 brīk(o?) aḍari baḍe kuberä puṣpakī nāma ‘Kubera rides his favourite vehicle, its name is Puspaka’. Either base art- variant with vart- ‘to roll’, whence Sogd. wrtn *vartana- and related words, or * urtara- from vart-, as inudara- ‘crystal’ to varta-‘stone’, and a- replacing u-.
[SVK] aḍa ‘other’ (Dict.) ; adara- ‘other’ (Dict.) aḍari ‘vehicle’ (Dict.)
These three entries appear to involve a single word aḍara- ‘that, yon’, aḍa is just a reduced form of aḍara- as pointed out by Bailey. That aḍara- means ‘that’ should have been clear from the LKh. rendering of Z5.77 ttū padandaimä u ttāru ‘I have created this and that’ by ttu *padedaima tta vā aḍara in Mañj 234 KBT 124, where ttāru corresponds to aḍara. In Hed. 3.13 KT4.22 there also seems to be a contrast between ttiña māśta ‘in this month’ and aḍaña māśta ‘in that month’. The remaining passages cited in the Dict. are from the Rāma story (KT 3.65—76). Some of them leave no room for doubt concerning the meaning of aḍa(ra).[Emmerick, II, p.14]

[DKS] ‘other’, III70.106 aḍārä jsanām ‘the other we will kill’; loc. sing. K 45.24 aḍāña ysīthai ‘in another birth’, Manj. 237 aḍauña, variant Z 5.80 ttārña; inst. sing, III 71.129 aḍārįna ttāja khu ā ‘when he came to another river’, in III 71.134 aḍariṃ ttāja khu ā; plural IV 20.16 khu aḍārye vyauli yuḍāṃda ‘ so that you caused other alarms’; Sid. 132r5 aḍārye, Tib. gźan ‘other’; V 268, 47a7 aḍārye kvṃāyse vīra ‘on the other side’. With initial i- in place of a- : K 146, 3v4 jabvī-dvipa rrivye pa iḍarai hidva-kṣīrä Samattai nāma kṣīrä ṣṭe ‘in Jambu-dvīpa in the south another Indian land there is by name the Samattai land’; II 89.45u iḍāriṃ jsām hā ciṃgä rruṃdä hīvī haḍä ‘ and another messenger of the Chinese king ’; II III.36 iḍāryāṃ iñakä. From *ar-tāra- ‘other’ to aḍara-, with -tāra- as Av. katāra-, kataras čit̠, Greek . πότεροι .

[DKS] ‘endless’,III 60.35 ahakhīysa aṇaṃscya ‘numberless (and) endless’; aṇiṃscya JS 39r3; aṇeṃscya Bcd 57VI, BS ananta-; compound, K 155.51 aṇeṃscya-rāsṃä Bcd 44v2 aṇeṃstyä; JS 39r4 aṇeṃscyānä. See näṣaṃskya, and analsca-.
[DKS] ‘unoppressed’, K 52.7.2 aṇahīśe harbaiśä bādä... byehīnä rāśṃä‘unsuppressed always may I get dominion’. To v 113, 35v1 anṛhīya-, BS anavamardita-. See nihalj-.
[DKS] ‘without desire’, Manj. 168 aṇaṃusa na re parśta (= BS apraṇihita-) ‘he no more passes without desire’; K 107.305 anaṃusa, K 55, 18r4 anṃāṃsa-, v 86, 5v2 anaulsa-.

[DKS] ‘excessively’, v 15, ib2 ata śśāraṇä ‘great service’, ib3 ata arrīmajse ‘very unclean’; v22, 1r6 atä atär añi ośä ‘very unfriendly, bad’, v 131, 52v4 atä dāru bulysu ‘very long’, v 183, 43v5 atä duṣkarä ‘very wonderful’; v 164, 113r4 atäphara-hvarātä mästa rre ‘the great king gluttonous’; to Av. ati, O.Ind. ati, IE Pok. 344, Greek Ετι. See also the preverb ti-, tti, ttu-, t-, tta-.
[DKS] ‘unsurpassable’, JS 6v3 attajsāḍa eṣṭāme vī ‘in supreme firmness’, to JS 13v4 ttajsāḍai ‘you surpassed’, from *(a)ti-čārta-, see pajsāḍa-, jairma-.

[DKS] ‘intact’, K 68.190 styūdi kiḍi attarrve baysgä, K 71, 10v3-4 styūda kīda attarve baysgä ‘hard, firm exceedingly, compact’, dyadic with styūda- ; possibly ‘unbroken’from base *ati-ruxta- as narrva- from *niruxta- ‘broken’,

[DKS] ‘unpolluted’, K 60, 34v4 cu harbīśvā bāḍvā āttāyā ṣṭa ‘which in all times is unpolluted’, glossing BS suci-and Khotan Saka vasvattd ‘purity’. From *a-tāyāna- to tā- ‘to melt, decay’ in Av. tāta-, Oss. D. tajun, tad, I. tajyn, tad ‘to melt, dissolve, corrupt’, D. tajnäγ ‘melting’, IE Pok. 1053 tā-: tə- ‘melt’ in O.Slav. taj, tajet, O.Russ, tajati, O.Engl. pāwan ‘thaw’, Greek Τάκω.

[DKS] ‘untrue, wrong’, K 56, 21r4 u tte biśą dharma prracaḍa ṣṭāri attāhīrā svabhāvana ttūśā; Manj. 145 attāhīre hvāñ(ā)me jsa ‘with improper speaking’; Manj. 148 harbaśa dharma attāherā deda vajsāre ‘ they see so many all dharma-elements as bad’, without negative Manj. 371. ttāhīrai rraṣṭa payseda ‘he knows it to be right, correct’, see ttāhiraa- ‘right’, BS samyak.
[DKS] ‘not returning’, BS avaivartika-, anāgāmin-. v 250.778; Ⅲ 113, 4r3 avīsadai; K 101.39 iīsedai. From īs- ‘to return’, with a- and hiatic -t-.
[DKS] ‘significant, not empty’, Ⅱ53.2 attuśīma-nāmī ‘with significant name’; K 152.3 attuśīmä-nāmai. See tuśśaa- ‘empty’.
[DKS] ‘unsurpassable’, JS 6r3 panate ttye-v-ī mu’śd’ä pajsa attrīma ‘there arose for you strong unsurpassable mercy to him’, from *a-tramya-, to base tar- ‘to cross’, with increment -am-.
[DKS] ‘not to be traversed’, K61, 39v2-3 tvā atsūmavīja tsūmą.
[DKS] ‘not taming, repressing’, v 117, 66v1 uysnaurāṇu adaṃgya, BS anigraha-, to dam- ‘ to tame’ in dīm-:danda-.

[DKS] ‘wrongful, unjust’, v 114, 63v4 adāta huṣṣa tsīndä ‘the irreligious prosper’, BS adharmo vardhate, to data-. K 15.117 adā kaiṇa, K 23.67 adā käṇa, K 31.24 adā kaiṇi ‘because of wrongs’; adātya- v 114, 63v3 ośānu adātyānu bvānānu, BS duṣkṛtānām; K15.114 adāyai, BS adharmeṇa.
[SVK] Bailey fails to distinguish here between the two words adāta- (noun) ‘non-Law, that which is not according to the Law (dharma)’ and adātia- (adjective) ‘unlawful, lawless’. In SuvK. 63v4 KT 5.114 [Suv 12.18] (quoted by Bailey) adāta huṣṣa tsindä means ‘lawlessness(es) increase(s)’ not ‘the irreligious’ which is adātya, adāya from adātia-. In Suv adāta- and adātia- regularly render Skt adharma and adhārmika respectively. [Skjœrvø, Ⅰ, p.14]

[DKS] ‘undimmed’, K 152.10 vasva adū agū pā’ ‘pure, undimmed, unpolluted, clear’, epithet of the jñāna- paramitā, from dau-: du ‘to obscure’, in Khotan Saka dumä ‘smoke’, Zor.P. dūt, N.Pers. dūd ‘smoke’, Khotan Saka duya ‘dusty (?)’; IE Pok. 261-7 dheu-.

[DKS] ‘invisible’, v110, 32v1 adyāneina ttarandarna ‘with invisible body’, BS adṛśyair ātmabhāvaiḥ; v 52.83b1 dyānai päṣkalä, u adyānei päskalä paśemate kä<dana> ‘conspicious attribute; and for abandoning the ugly attribute’.
[DKS] ‘unnumbered, countless’, SuvO. 68v4 anaṃkhästa nayuta satä ysāre kūla, BS acintiyā niyuta-sahasra-koṭiyo; I 252, 1a4 gen. plur. <a>naṃkhiṣṭinu raṃnānu, BS aneka-ratna-, see haṃkhīysa-.

[DKS] ‘limitless (?)’, Manj. 42 aysmva sa vasūjāña anada tc(e)rai ‘the mind is just to be purified, it is to be made unlimited (?)’. Possibly to Oss. D. ändä, I. ädtä ‘outside’; hardly BS ananta-. See īyānda-.

[DKS] ‘to tolerate’, v 135, 1a4 anaṃdīśśānaina a<ysmūna> ‘with tolerant (indifferent) mind’. See araṃdīśś-.
[SGS] anandīśś- ‘to be indifferent to’ ? V e, VI mid. intr. A
+ I-A hvą’ ndäna Z 12. 114.
3 sg. pres., O.Kh.: anandīśśäte Z 12. 114; anaṃdīśśäte Suv, K. 65V5 KT 5. 116 tr. samupekṣate.
3 pl. pres, mid., O.Kh.: anaṃdīśśāre Suv, K. 64r6 KT 5. 115. [p.6]
[DKS] ‘infrangible’, Manj. 348-9 harbaiśā dharmā prrara apanava anarrūjya ‘the nature of all dharma-elements is non-originated, unbreakable’.

[DKS] ‘not poured upon’, Ⅲ 92.237 u na-ānahā anarva māśa’kä tcerą̄ ‘(the poultice) must be made of the plant māśa’kä (BS mācikā) unmoistened’, from ā-nah- ‘pour upon, moisten’, dyadic with anarva ‘not poured upon’; hence from base rau- ‘flow’, anarva < *a-niruta-, distinct from anarrva- < *a-niruxta- ‘unbroken’.
[DKS] ‘of endless splendour’, v 123, c2v5, to näṣa’skya ‘end’, and BS tejas-.
[DKS] ‘without a share’, v 29, 47v4 ta anasu ne kaśte ‘so he does not come to be shareless’.
[DKS] ‘without’ Manj. 374 anā rū rūvyā daitta ‘he sees the formed things (BS rūpiya-, -ka-) to be without form’ (BS rūpa-), see s.v. hajse ‘ form ’. Here anā for older anau, ano.
[DKS] ‘not bound (?)’, Ⅲ 104.36 paśa’ rai aṃ.nā raṣṭa ‘sunshine, unchecked, direct’. From *a-nāxta- to nāj- ‘to join’, in nāju, haṃnāj-; but possibly ąhanā < *ahaṃnāxta-.
[DKS] ‘free from disease’, N 76.15 anāchā himäta jya-āchā ‘they became free of disease, healthy’, BS nānārogebhyah parimocitāni, arogāṇi babhūvuḥ. See āchai ‘illness’.
[DKS] ‘undisturbed’, Ⅲ 131a3 anāphäḍa dvāredärśyau hudahī<nyau> ‘undisturbed, with 32 mahāpuruṣa (marks)’, to phar- see āphir-, āphiḍa-.

[DKS] ‘without fault, innocent’, v 339, 79r1 tta hvate se anārrä gyasta balysa naḍe ysaṃthu kuṣṭa nāte ‘so he spoke, saying, O deva Buddha where did the innocent man take birth?’, BS āha, anaparādhikasya bhagavan puruṣasya kutropapattih; v 64.42 anārī from anārrä yi; see ārra- ‘fault’.
[DKS] ‘isolated’, Z 24.445 ṣī jaḍī anāvu ‘this is only ignorance’, -āvu beside au, o as Z 13.113 āvuṣṭe ‘lips’ beside Ⅲ 130a1 austä. See anau.

[DKS] ‘inaccessible (?)’, Z 12.71 parigraha ttrāma cu ṣṣāvānu anāśśa ‘such possessions which are inaccessible to śrāvaka-listeners’; Z 10.9 ggaṃbhīra vasuta anāśśa. . . bvāmata ‘profound, pure, inaccessible bodhi-knowledge’. See nas- in hanas-.
[DKS] ‘unworthy’, JS 28v4-29r1 anāṣi’ṇe nāvai phare ysaṃthe veśūna ‘you accepted many unworthy evil births ’; to āṣa’ṇa- ‘worthy’.

[DKS] ‘disjointed’, Z 20.39 anāskotta darra ‘disjointed, torn up’, with -skautta- in Bcd 48r3 haskauttä, BS abhiyukta- ‘joined’. Base skaup- or skaub- in skumb- of Šuγnī wiškamb-:wiškūvd ‘to sort (wool)’, O.Slav. skubati ‘pluck, ravel out’, IE Pok. 955 skeubh-.

[DKS] ‘without beginning’, Z 5.85 ttäna anāstanä hvatä saṃtsāri, =Manj. 243 anāsta satsāra hva ‘therefore samsāra is said to be beginningless’; Z 9.26 anāstan ahämäta, =Manj. 404 anāstaina ahaimye ‘beginningless non-produced’, to āstana-.

[DKS] ‘refugeless’, v 381, 3b3, BS nirāśa- ‘hopeless’, v 63.31 anāspitāṃ sattāṃ; v 64.2 anāspe; JS 22v1 anāspeta anāha (BS anātha-); JS 28v2 anāspete śatcaṃpha; Ⅲ Ⅱ, 21r3 anāspāyeri ‘more refugeless’. See āspātā- ‘refuge’.

[DKS] ‘hostility’, K 35.82 animūnäīnīyi ‘was planning enmity’, = K 18.203 avamauna īde ‘he works contempt’ (BS avamāna-), = K 26.133 ñahara āstada ‘he began trouble’. See nimāna- ‘regret’. Possibly animūna- for *avamāna-.
[DKS] ‘not contemptible, not humble’, v 111, 33v1 aniyaśśu aṣṭakulcu, BS abhaṇḍana- ‘not abusing’. See niyaśśa-, ñaśa-.

[DKS] ‘lack of virility, non-virility’, v 52, 83a4 paṃjsa päta’ñä anīratete u dīḍetä hamurgyatetä, bätandetä ‘the five powers, non-virility, and low character, forgetfulness, confusion of mind, <folly?>’, the BS panca-bala- of śraddhā, vīrya-, smṛti-, samādhi-, prajñā, in reverse, if it is accepted that dīḍetä can correspond to ṣraddhā and bätandetä to samādhi-. This gives the analysis *a-naryatāti to nara- ‘man’ with -īra- < -arya-. The context excludes an-arya- ‘ignoble’.

[DKS] ‘without grasping’, v 124, 4b4; K 53.10.10 akāṣṭye anihvarrdye bāvani gīhna, K 63.78r1 akāṣṭye anahvardye bāvaña gīhna ‘by aid of bhāvanā- meditation inconceivable, ungraspable’, Manj. 354 anūhvarada, =BS agrāhya-. See nuhvarr- ‘to grasp’.
[DKS] ‘not adult’, Z 22.123 paṃjsa-satä-saluvo anūḍo ‘not adult at age 500 years ’; Z 24.125 rrundi dūta anūḍa ‘king’s daughter not adult’. See ūḍa- ‘grown, old’, base barz-:bržda- ‘to grow in size’.
[DKS] ‘uncovered’, Ⅲ 12, 21v5 ṣa cu anūḍa vrrīśe ‘he who wears (the thread) being unclothed’. See ūḍa- ‘covered ’ from base var- ‘to cover ’.
[DKS] Manj. 354 ‘not grasped (polluted)’ like the lotus in mud.
[DKS] ‘not defeated’, v 113, 35v1 īṇete hīñe jsa anṛhīyä ‘unbeaten by alien army’, BS anavamardita-. See also aṇahīśe. Base ni-θrang- ‘to press down’.
[DKS] ‘unenduring’, Manj. 270 aneṣṭava mvaśta’ bure pīttä ‘being unstable, within a short time fails’, = Ⅲ 29, 42b2 mu’śa’ buri pīttä.
[DKS] ‘unsubstantial’, SuvO. 24r4 ttarandarä anārūhä u ayicä u aneṣṭavanä, BS kāyaś ca niśceṣṭa nirvyāparaś ca asārakaḥ ‘the body motionless and inactive (BS akṛtya-) and unsubstantial’. See eṣṭ-.

[DKS] ‘without’, Sid. 15v1 anau hvadä khaṣṭą, BS annapānād ṛte ‘without food and drink’, Ⅲ 21, 9b2 anau rūväna, BS arūpiṇaḥ ‘formless’; ano JS 37v4. From ana-, see also anāvu. To Greek ἄνευ, Goth. inu, O.Saxon āno beside M.Parth.T. ’n’-, Oss. DI. änä-, and Sogd. nw-, IE Pok. 318 eneu. See also anā.
[DKS] ‘not eternal’, Ⅲ 24, 21a1 anauṣkājsī, Z 22.271 anauṣkāmjsye, v 52, 83b2 <a>noṣkājsya hära oṣkājsya nai härānu; v 52, 83b2 anauṣkājsyatetä. See oṣku.
[DKS] ‘not despondent’, Sid. 7v1, BS aviṣādī, Tib. sro śi-ba. See nuvaṃth-.
[DKS] ‘difficult’, Sid. 103v2 anvaśta, Tib. dkah-ba ‘difficult’; JS 2r1 vṛttä anvaśta ‘the metre difficult’ (BS vṛtti-). See nvaśta- ‘easy’.

[DKS] ‘opposed, hostile’, SuvP. 72r4 anvaśtā ṣai śe satvä, BS pratikula-darśī; Ⅱ 109.5 anvaśtā barāṃ, Ⅱ 84.20 anvaśtā sahyām:dūm ‘we suffered opposition’; Sid. 9v4 anvaśtävai ni hime, BS viruddham na bhavet; v 246, 12a2 anvaśte vaśu’de bīśī janīdä (BS omits). From a- and (a)nu- ā-stay- ‘to conform’.
[SVK] This is obviously the Late Khotanese form of an Old Khotanese abstract noun *anvaś(ta)tāti- ‘difficulty, hardship’ made from the adjective anvaśta- ‘difficult’.[Skjœrvø, Ⅰ, p.15]
[DKS] ‘immodesty’, Manj. 67 aksārmauña apakṣarāttai, = BS hrīr apatrapā. See pakṣäre and kṣārma, kṣär-.
[DKS] ‘unknown’, Sid. Ⅰ bis r1, see paysān- ‘to recognise’.

[DKS] ‘attacks it’, v 66.9 apahāyśīye-t-ī ṣṭakūlai yanāti ṣi’ hvi mūlą, bāśtä mīḍi ‘he who may attack it and abuse it, that man dies presided over by the Rat’. Parallel phrase v 330, 13v4 sūtru aprramā<nu ya>nde, BS G 37, Ⅱb3 sad-dharma-pratikṣepād, v 388, 19r1 ttu dātu apramānu yanāre, BS G 37, 13b6 sad-dharma-prati-kṣepakaiḥ satvaiḥ; also SuvP. 64v1 cu dā prakṣauttai īme, BS sad-dharmaḥ prakṣiptaḥ syād. . .me; K 61, 41r4 ci ttu sūttrą prrakṣīvīdi. Hence apahāysīye denominative from *pahāysa- ‘grasping, approving’ to base haz- ‘seize’, Av. haz-, O.Ind. sahate, IE Pok. 888-9 seĝh-, Greek ἔχω, ἔσχον.
[DKS] ‘without fat’, Sid. 135r4, Tib. śa-snum bag čhuŋ-ba. See päyä ‘fat’.

[DKS] ‘uninterrupted’, Ⅲ 48.6 apūṣṭye bhāvana gīhna, K 112.372 apvaṣṭya bāvaña gīhna ‘by help of uninter-rupted bhāvanā-meditation ’; 11 72.5 śā salī śiri apvaṣṭi khu vyachīṃdi harbaiśi pīle ‘ (exert yourselves) for one year well, uninterruptedly, so that all troubles vanish’. Possibly =BS anācchedya-; Ⅲ 53.111 BS anāchida. See -pūṣṭa-, from *pa(ti)brašta- ‘break off’. Parallel to K 54, 14r2 aharṣṭä bhāvana.
[DKS] ‘uninjured’, Ⅱ 103.59 kalpāṃdāṃtta dai jsa apai’cāmttä ṣṭāna ‘being uninjured by the fire of the kalpa- age’s end’, to pa’tcautta-, petcautta- ‘injured, checked’, Tib. ñams-śiŋ.
[DKS] ‘a plant name’, Sid. 13v4, BS sugandhaka-, Tib. sugandhika. If the name is translated, pauca- from pau-:pū- ‘to rot’ would yield a name ‘not putrid’, hence ‘sweet’. See haṃbūta-, puva, phuva-.

[DKS] ‘speechless’, Manj.329 apyāya vī śā pava (BS pada- ‘verse’) pyūṣḍe harbaśu pyūṣṭa pachīysde ‘the dumb hears one verse, he can hear all’; Manj. 381 vaina hvāñāka apyāyau vī kūṣṭa drrā mase ṣkaujai nai īda‘without speaker, in non-speaking, where to the extent of a hair there are not saṃshāra-acts’. See pätāy- ‘to speak’.

[DKS] ‘not heard’, Ⅰ 254v4 pyūṣṭu u apyūstu ‘heard and not heard’, BS śrutvā; beside K Ⅰ, 135v2 ttu pyūṣṭu pyūṣḍe ne avyūṣṭu pyūṣḍe ‘he hears that heard (thing) he does not hear the unheard’; Tib. thos-pa ñid thos-pa yin-gyi, ma thos-pa-las thos-pa ma yin-pa. See pyūv’-: pyūṣṭa-.
[DKS] ‘without fear, danger’, K 28.180 parśta apvaine ‘escapes without fear’ parallel to K 29.184 parśta avesta ‘escapes unafraid’. See pu’vaṇa- ‘fear’.
[DKS] ‘without fear, safe’, Ⅱ 123.4091.6 apvenye bāḍä ‘in a safe time’.

[DKS] ‘pejorative adjective’, Ⅲ 69.93-4 kṣārma bīdāṃdä pharākä, śūrī-vaṃ aphārä hamye ‘they felt much shame, their valour became a disgrace’. Once aphāra- is variant to haphāra-; K 70, 5v1 tta drūjana aphāra hūñīdä, =K 67.158 tti drūjina haphārä hvāñīṃdi ‘so with falsehood they speak confusion’. Base phar- ‘to speak’, pharā- ‘speech’, pher- ‘to speak’ from phāraya-, or base phar- ‘to disturb’, or with later -r- for -rr- from phārra- ‘fortune, high position’, or with a- from ā- for *āphāra- ‘disturbance’, uncertain.
[DKS] ‘not bound’, Manj. 304 abasta harbaśa satva ‘freed all beings’, to bañ-:basta-.
[DKS] ‘untimely’, v 170, 2r4; v 125, 6b3 kvī abāḍä nīroskasāte ‘when untimely water floods him’ in a list of untimely deaths, BS akāla-maraṇāni.
[DKS] ‘without doubt’, v 158, 193r4 thu abätamai hämu ‘be without doubt’, later abyamai, Ⅰ 185, 104r2 abyamiṃ (-iṃ = -ai), BS nātra saṃśayaḥ.
[DKS] ‘unwakened’, K 34.64 abīysādi khu jiśtä ‘unawakened like a devī-goddess’, variant K 25.114 avayseda khva jaśta, to biysānda- ‘awakened, aware ’, BS saṃbuddha-. See biysān- ‘to awake’.
[DKS] ‘without tongue’, v 146, 71v4 ā vā abiśātä u kārrä ‘either dumb or deaf’, to biśā- ‘tongue’.

[DKS] ‘not aware’, SuvP. 63r3, BS ajānanta-; abstr. abus<t>attäte v 139, 1a5; Manj. 342 abusta-; SuvO. 24v7 abustatete jsa, BS avidyayā.
[SVK] abustąñä is not an adjective meaning ‘not aware’ but loc. sg. of an abstract noun abustaña- meaning ‘ignorance’. [Emmerick, Ⅱ, pp. 15-16]
[DKS] ‘weak’, Ⅱ 109.2789.5-6 ama ttaña haśa’ abaumaya hamarya ‘you in that place may be weak’, to būmaya, būmatä ‘strong’.
[DKS] K 56, 21v3 abausti prracaina, Manj. 342; 344, to abusta-.
[DKS] ‘not open’, K 21.9; abyāva K 29.183, variant K 37.123 abyāṣṭi, see bā’tai ‘open’ and base s.v. biyāśś-.
[DKS] ‘not reached’, K 54, 15v3 abyāṃda ttuśāttā, = BS abhāva-śūnyatā, later form of abyauda- from byeh- ‘to get’.
[DKS] ‘at dawn’, Ⅱ 16, 4b5 khu ma abyūṣṭä vīra kaṃthä hīsīṃdä ‘when here at dawn they come to the city’, to byūṣṭa- ‘lightened, dawned’.
[DKS] ‘not attainment’, Manj. 165 ba’ysūña pade abyehāme jsa cerāña, to byeh-.

[DKS] K 57, 26r4 cu abyehāṣṭejsa bīdi ba’ysūśtä ‘who by not attainment got bodhi-knowledge’; Manj. 371 cva abyehāscyī jsa baiśa ttāhīrai rraṣṭa payseda ‘who by not attainment knows all correctly, rightly’.

[DKS] ‘not reached, not found, non-existent’, Manj. 233 padīmāka abyauda ‘creator not found’, Manj. 296 nairāttama abyaudä ‘non-self not existent’, K 108.303-4 ysyāma u ysara maraṇa baiśa ahamya ajya abyauda ‘birth and old age, death all are not produced, not perishing, not existent’. See byeh-:byauda-.
[DKS] ‘not dear’, Manj. 384-5 bvāme jsa harbaśa daitta abrrīyī brrīyī rasta sa khu pūra āye uca ‘by bodhi- knowledge all appears not liked, (and) liked, just as the moon is seen in water’. See brya-.

[DKS] ‘not destroyed’, v 113, 35v1 abva<tä a>ysmū hämāñu, BS avikṣipta-cittena ‘with mind undistraught’, Z 5.114 abuvatu, Z 22.291 abvata-, with first written abutu. See buvan-, BS vilupyate, upahata-.

[DKS] ‘abundant’, Manj. 245 va(ṣa)ya āvīda abvātta (the mind) sees the abundant sense-objects’ (BS viṣaya-) variant to Manj. 348 vaiṣaya āvīda pharāka ‘sees many sense-objects’; and variant Manj. 246 vaṣaye āvada abvatta (read āv(ī)da abv(ā)tta). Possibly from a- intensive (see IE Pok. 281-2 e-, o-) with base bau- ‘to abound’, see s.v. buru. With participle -āta-, as in gaisātta- ‘returned’ (*gṛtsāta-). See also Oss. äbualγ ‘extraordinary’; with adjective äbualγ tyxdžyn ‘exceedingly violent’ from *a-bvāga-, and O.Ind. RV ábhva-, AV abhvà-, ‘monstrous’ beside víbhvan-, noted BSOAS 20, 1957, 48.
[SVK] abvātta is not an Iranian word meaning ‘abundant’ but a Late Khotanese spelling of Buddhist Sanskrit abhūta ‘non-existent’, which is attested in Z in the spellings abhūtta and abūta-. [Emmerick, Ⅰ, p.16]

[DKS] ‘not experienced’, Manj. 75 śara dī kīra abvāṣṭa ‘unexperienced in good and bad works’. See bvāṣṭa-.
[SVK] abvāṣṭa is an abstract noun meaning ‘ignorance’. [Emmerick, Ⅱ, p.17]
[DKS] ‘not knowing’, SuvP. 63r3, BS aprajānanta-; SuvP. 64v2 abvīya, BS ajānanta-. See buv-:busta-, with suffix -īya-, as ysīnīya-.
[DKS] ‘not thinking’, v 131, 1r1 dyadic before akā’mate jsa āste. See mañ-.

[DKS] ‘distress, distressful’, v 29, 47r3 o yi jsa ysīru pätāyätä o ye vā vätä amatau nätā’yätä ‘either speaks roughly to one or commands one harshly ’ with parallel ysīra- ‘rough’ and amatau; v 30, 73v1 amatauya kaśte hvaittä ‘he falls into distress, he is beaten’. Later amauva-, loc. plural amauvuā, Ⅲ 113, 4v3-4 cvai nāma hvāñi amauvuā byaugvā baṃdana-śālvā ni kaśti ‘he who cites the name does not fall into harsh bonds, into prisons’; v 250.783-4 cvai nāma hvāñe amauvuā byūṃgvā baṃdana-śālvā na kaśte; K 102.46-7 cvai nāma hvāñe ni imauvuā byūṃgvā u ni baṃdana-śālvā kaśte. From base am- ‘to treat violently’, Av. Yasna 71.17 xšayasča amayavā̊sča, Zor.P. gloss šēvan ut mōδak ‘ lament and woe’, to Av. ama- ‘force’, O.Ind. ama- ‘force’, amīvā- ‘illness’, amīti ‘to injure’, participle -ānta-. For the suffix -au, loc. sing, -auya, gen. plur. -vāṃ, inst. plur. -vyau, note sarau ‘lion’, plur. sarauva, gen.plur. sarautāṃ, loc. sing. rraysauya ‘empty’, hamau ‘bowl’, inst. plur. hamvyau, parau ‘command’, gen. plur. parauvāṃ jsa, loc. sing. parauya.

[DKS] amayai ‘title (before proper names)’, K 100.292 amayai khara-painä; K 100.290 amayai maukṣaidra; K 100.294 amayai ejattūha’, K 100.297 amayai arsa[nd]lana; v 237, 31-39 amaye cīna kharasana, 34 amayai cīna ṣau kharasana. Possibly *amayaka- ‘forceful, in authority’ from base am- (see amatau). Possibly from maya-, māya ‘fortunate’.
[DKS] ‘not like’, K 5,144r4 duṣkarūṇa amāñandūna salāva hvatāndä, Tib. ŋo-mćhar rmad-du byun-bahi čhos-kyi sgra hang hbyin-to, ‘they spoke astonishing wonderful words’.
[DKS] ‘unfermented’, Sid. 20v4 amāstą ñye ‘unfermented buttermilk’, BS manda-jātaṃ tu mastu (=maṇḍa-), Tib. źo ma langs-pa. See māsta-, māya-, meva.
[DKS] ‘old woman’, K 38.136, variant K 29.198 māmā.Widely used, Germanic OHG amma, O.Norse amma, Span. mama, Greek μάμα Lat. mamma, O.Ind. ambā.
[DKS] ‘mango’, Sid. 14r1; Sid. 18v2 ambrrä, loan-word O.Ind. āmra-. Sogd. n’mry ‘sweet’ is from *an-āmraka-, see āhvaraa-.

[DKS] ‘without core’, Ⅲ 49.16 cu baiśä hīra amya butte ‘who understands all dharma-elements to be without sub­stance’, like BS asāraka- ‘without firm inner part’. From *a-madya- to myāna- ‘centre’ from *madyāna-, Zor.P. miyān, Sogd. Bud. mδ’ny, myδ’ny ‘in the middle’, Av. maiδya-, Oss. D. medäg, I. midäg. See myāna-.
[DKS] ‘invisibility (?)’, Ⅱ 115.23 haira jsā sāja na tta paṣṭa ayakṣā ‘study the dharma-elements, do not set out to the unseen’. See pyaṣṭa- ‘visible’.

[DKS] or ay.va ‘epithet of demons’ (second akṣara lost), v 64.45-6 cu būri āśa’ ṣṭāna auda ay.sa kalabūttana ti biśa maṃ parauya ṣṭāri ‘whoever being in the sky (BS ākāśa-) down to the kalapūtana demons, those all are under my orders’. Reading and connexion unknown.
[DKS] ‘unborn’, Z 6.7; Manj. 250 aysāye mera nai īda, from ysan-: ysāta- ‘be born’.
[DKS] ‘lively (not despondent)’, Ⅱ 40.38 hīrāsaka iysīye basaka jsi ‘from the black frisky calf’ (SDTV 121), see ysīta-.

[DKS] ‘I’; with pronouns ayse, aysi, aysai, aysām, aysā; with ī ‘indeed’ aysai; Manj. 154 ayse; K 137.905 aysi; Ⅲ 75.221 aysai; Ⅲ 69.103 aysāṃ; Ⅲ 71.128 aysā (-ā ‘you’); K 47.53 aysai ‘I indeed’. With independent pronoun K 47.53 aysā ūhū ‘ I... you’; SuvO. 3v7 aysuṃ jsa. Av. azǝm, O.Pers. adam, Pašto ǝa, Waxī wuz, Ormuṛī az, Sogd. ’zw; Oss. äz. O.Ind. aham, IE Pok. 291 O.Slav. azŭ, Greek έγών.

[DKS] ‘I’; with pronouns ayse, aysi, aysai, aysām, aysā; with ī ‘indeed’ aysai; Manj. 154 ayse; K 137.905 aysi; Ⅲ 75.221 aysai; Ⅲ 69.103 aysāṃ; Ⅲ 71.128 aysā (-ā ‘you’); K 47.53 aysai ‘I indeed’. With independent pronoun K 47.53 aysā ūhū ‘ I... you’; SuvO. 3v7 aysuṃ jsa. Av. azǝm, O.Pers. adam, Pašto ǝa, Waxī wuz, Ormuṛī az, Sogd. ’zw; Oss. äz. O.Ind. aham, IE Pok. 291 O.Slav. azŭ, Greek έγών.

[DKS] ‘I’; with pronouns ayse, aysi, aysai, aysām, aysā; with ī ‘indeed’ aysai; Manj. 154 ayse; K 137.905 aysi; Ⅲ 75.221 aysai; Ⅲ 69.103 aysāṃ; Ⅲ 71.128 aysā (-ā ‘you’); K 47.53 aysai ‘I indeed’. With independent pronoun K 47.53 aysā ūhū ‘ I... you’; SuvO. 3v7 aysuṃ jsa. Av. azǝm, O.Pers. adam, Pašto ǝa, Waxī wuz, Ormuṛī az, Sogd. ’zw; Oss. äz. O.Ind. aham, IE Pok. 291 O.Slav. azŭ, Greek έγών.

[DKS] ‘of aysūra-colour’, Ⅱ 60.8-9 kabala śā u aysūra-gūna dajūna baimya kamaiśkä ‘one kambala-cloth (BS kambala-) and of aysūra colour, flame-coloured bright kamiśka-cloth’. Possibly az-:za- ‘blue’ with -a- bara-, see ysamye ‘vitriol’.
[DKS] ‘not pleasant’, Ⅲ 60.45 aysūṣkä mari vīvā nāṃda maṃ vi satva ‘unpleasant here the beings accepted vipāka- ripening in my case’; SuvP. 73v1, BS aniṣṭa-.

[DKS] ‘vulture’, JS 24v1 pura ra pe’me’ṣṭi aysgaṃ ‘the vulture seized the young ones’; K 21.4 aysgana-rūvyi ‘in vulture-form’, K 28.179 -e; K 37.117 vari aysgini-rūvya śā rakṣä’jsi mūñye ‘there dwells one demoness (BS rākṣasī) in vulture-shape’. See uysgana-.

[DKS] ‘a commodity’, possibly ‘goat’s corn’, v 174a1 u aysdāṃ 10śeṃ (=daśeṃ) hvaṃḍä gūñä 1 baṃ 1 ‘and corn (?) for ten men, one sack, one packet’; v 174, a2 u aysdāṃ kha 4 auśyaka aysdāṃ kha 2 ‘and corn (?) 4 kha-measures and Auśyaka corn (?) 2 hha-measures (similarly with other names); v 174b12 ṣi’ vā aysdāṃ puḍai ‘he presented corn (?)’. Tumšuq eźdanā kalasta ‘skin-­bag for corn (?)’ may belong here (see karasta-). Base aza- ‘goat’, Av. aza- with dānā- ‘grain’. The aza- is in the Nīrangastān 114v9, Zor.P. ’z, ’zy, Caucasian Adige ač’e, Qabard aže.

[DKS] ‘supporter (?)’, Ⅱ 80.12 ṣą mä aysdārä aśau’laka svaha’ka ‘this my supporter unharmed, in safety ’; ‘main­tenance’, Ⅱ 125.5-6 u īñakä bisā iysdāra tti jsām vā rrvī vī haiṣṭāṃdä ‘ and the maintenance of the company they then sent to the Court’, see AM, n.s., Ⅱ, 1964, 13. Base uz- with dār- ‘hold’, see iysdāḍa-, 11 111-17 iysdāḍe si ‘he reported that. . .’. See aysdaura-.
[DKS] ‘safe’, Ⅱ 82.58 ṣa ma sagaśīla tceną aysdeña svahä’ka, parallel to Ⅱ 80.12 ṣą mä aysdārä aśau’laka svaha’ka, quoted s.v. aysdāra-. From *uysdāranya- ‘supported, safe’.
[DKS] ‘to blow upon, cool’, Sid. 152v1 aysdemāñä* to be cooled’, Tib. bsgranŋs-la; Participle aysdauda Sid. 20r4. See dam- ‘to blow’, uysdam-.

[DKS] ‘young’, Sid. 6v5; 7r3 BS bāla-; aysdo Sid. 7r1. From *azatāva- from arz- ‘ to grow ’, Oss. D. iräzun, iräzt, I. räzyn, räzydtän, räzt ‘to grow’. IE Pok. 26-7 al- ‘to grow’ (see alīya-) with increment. See alysānaa- ‘youth’,
[DKS] ‘possession’, Ⅲ 80.20 majṣyī jsaiṇi aysdaurä ‘the woman’s fine property’. See aysdāra-.

[DKS] ‘tears away, steals’, Ⅲ 36-7 aysdyūva ragyau jsa gesta yäda īsakye ‘ tears from the banks, turning, it makes whirlpools’, = Ⅲ 34.12 aysdyäva ragā jsa gesta yada īsakye, = Ⅲ 40.15 aysadruvą raṃgyau jsä gąistą īsakyai yaṃdai, = Ⅲ 46.20 aysdyūävi ragāṃ jsa gestą yida dvanakye. See also K 56, 20r4 viṣaya āysdyūvi ‘steals the objects of sense’. Base dabya- > dyū-, with -vi from -äte, see cog­nates s.v. dyūka ‘robbers’.

[DKS] ‘squatting’, Sid. 102v5 aysdrraphai *ñāma (written brrāma) ‘sitting in squatting position’, BS utkuṭikāsanam, Tib. ćog-ćog-pur hdug-pa. Base draf-, dramf- from IE *dhrembh- ‘hold together’, cf. Yidγa dīzo ‘squatting’ han-daizā-.

[DKS] ‘consisting of an excursion place, park’, K 49.3.7-8 padmāysina kūlārä pātcä, śira gvahe añi añi thāna aysdravaṣṭa vasva ūryāna ‘lotus seats, pavilions next, excellent abodes, various places, park-like clean gardens’. From *uz-drava- ‘place of excursion’, with adjectival suffix -sta-, dyadic with BS udyāna- ‘idem’. To base drav-: dru- ‘to run’ in Av. drāvaya-, draoman-, aēšmō. drūta- ‘attacked by aēšma-fury’, glossed Zor.P. ēšm-drūt, with Zor.P. hnrwn, Pāzand handurun (Mēnōk ī xrat, ed. An-klesaria, 5.6), O.Ind. dravati, druta-; IE Pok. 204-6 dreu-.
[DKS] ‘he flew up’, Ⅲ 73.180 aysdrauttä mā’ hā pūṣa pastä ‘the fly flew up, at once it fell away’. See drrautta hamīya ‘is able to fly’, base drāh-.

[DKS] ‘channel (?)’, something made of stone, Ⅲ 80.31 baysga aysbanä sagīnā ṣperīdä ‘the many stone channels pour out’; Ⅲ 37.8 spyakīnai byauśau’ka īhe’ja aysbanvāi ‘the flower bud is stopped in the channels’; Ⅲ 34.13 spyakīnai pyauśa’ka ai’heja aysbanakvā; Ⅲ 46.22 <s>pya- kīnai pyauśaką iheja aysbanakvā. From *uz-band- ‘to hold back by a bank’, like N.Pers. band ‘weir’, Pašto wasta ‘pool’, see s.v. pastā-.
[DKS] ‘to roast’, Sid. 146r2 aysbrījsāñä, Tib. brŋos-pa; Sid. 147r4 iysbrījsāñä; Sid. 147v4 eysbrrījsāñą. From uz- with braig-, see cognates s.v. brījs-.

[DKS] ‘mind’, rendering BS manas- (Ⅲ 21, 8b3 aysmya yaṃ, BS manasi kuru), BS mata- (v 244, 4b4 aysmūna, BS matena), BS citta- (v 330, 20r3 aysmū panata, BS G 37, 17r5 cittam utpādayām āsuḥ), BS cetana- (Bcd 49r3 aysmuna, BS cetanato), BS vijñāna- (K 56, 20v3), and K 5, 144v1 aysmuī vaṣṭāmato, BS samādhi-. Inflected forms are nom. sing, aysmū, aysmu, later aysmva; gen. sing, aysmuvä, aysmuvi, nva aysmūi, aysmuī, aysmvī; inst. sing, aysmūna, aysmu jsa; loc. sing, aysmya; uncertain Ⅲ 130.23 aysmyani. With the pronoun yi K 58, 28r3, Z 24.196 aysmūtī. Adjectives are -yaa- v91, 611r2 aysmuyai, parallel to biśātīnai (with -t-, not -n-) ‘of the tongue’; -īnaa-, Manj.40 aysmvīnaa-, JS19r3 aysmvījvā; aysmūnaa-, adjective, ‘ of the mind’, Ⅲ 44.41-2 aysmūna pūna ‘ arrows of the mind’; ibid, aysmūnai bīsana ‘by the mental servant’; and -ja- Sid. 3Ⅱ aysmyaja, BS mānasa-. Dyadic are K 56, 20v1 aysmū vijñānä, and Ⅲ 71.143 aysmū uvī. Compounds are Sid. 7v1 garkha-aysmu ‘heavy-minded’; II 89.39 sāḍa-aysmva ṣṭāre ‘are cold-minded’, and v 123, 3r2 <du>ṣkareñäna ārāhäta-aysmuvā(fem. nom. sing.), BS vismaya-āvarjita-mānasā ‘with mind drawn by astonishment’. Two later spellings dissolve the conjuncts Ⅱ 130, b6 aysamū, and K 72.27 aysimūna. Analysis still not decided. Possibly uz-mu- from ays- (anticipating later ays- from uys-), with -mu- by -u- suffix from man-:ma- ‘to think’ (IE Pok. 726-8 men-). The basic ‘thinking’ contrasts with uysānā ‘self’ from an-:ā- ‘to breathe’. See Addendum.

[DKS] ‘to sound’, Ⅲ 36.5 sānä aysamvīrradā tsīda ha’da spūläkau ‘(the birds) range singing amorously among the buds’ (BS sphoṭaka-), with -mvīrr- from mvar-y-, parallel to gvīr- ‘sound, sing’ from gvar-y- Ⅲ 34.10 sāha’na gvīradā tsīda hada spūlakau, = Ⅲ 46.18 sā’ha’na gvīradą̄ tsīda hadaṃ spūälakām. See aysmūra-.

[DKS] ‘sound, noise’, Ⅲ 34.16 aysmūryau jūhānai sāñīda pavanaka ‘amorous with sounds they raise the pollens’, = Ⅲ 46.26 āṃysmūryau jūhānai sāñīda pavinaka, = Ⅲ 37.11 āṃysmūryau jūhaunai sāñä pavänaka. From uys- with base mūr-, mvīr- ‘to sound, sing’ see s.v. mura- ‘ speech’.

[DKS] ‘to overlook, tolerate, be indifferent’, v 99, v4 dyadic araṃdīśāmata uvikṣa ‘tolerance’; v 99, v2 uvikṣa araṃdīśśāmata, BS upekṣāṃ Elsewhere only anaṃdīśś- with -n- replacing -r-, Ⅲ 5, 12r4 ma anaṃdīśśa ma hāmuri yana ‘do not overlook, do not forget’, Ⅲ 2, 20v4 ma aña yana ma anaṃdīśä ‘ do not act otherwise, do not tolerate’, Z 12.114 anaṃdīśśäte, v 114, 63V2 cīyä rre anaṃdīśśäte ksīrū bvānu o adātu ‘when the king overlooks ruin and injustice in the land’, BS yadā hy upekṣate rājā duṣkṛtam viṣaye sthitaṃ, v115, 64r2 rre anaṃdīśśākä, BS rājā hy upekṣakaḥ ‘neglectful king’.
[DKS] ‘wild (?), K 154.41 cu bura vā yāla arājsa jūṣū kūlą ‘or whatever evil wild things I do to disturb the Vajra-kula’. Taken as adjective to araa-, as khūṇājsa- ‘having holes’.

[DKS] ‘wild-natured (?), Manj.108 śera ne yanīda arā-bū ‘(the ignorant) do not do good things, being wild- natured’, taken as araa-buva-. Base ara- ‘wild’, ara-, araa- as first component, to Av. ara-, Oss. ärra ‘wild, mad’ (as the young boy Batraz is called ärra läppu ‘ wild boy’), Sogd. ”r’k *āraka-, IE Pok. 27-8 al- ‘be wild’, see BSOAS 24, 1961, 473, adding possibly Hittite allaniya- ‘ to be restive (horse) ’. The -bū of arā-bū is from bau-: bū- ‘to be’.

[DKS] ‘inflammation’, Sid. 138v2 agvā vī arādā hame ‘ in the limbs inflammation occurs’, BS dāhavant-, Tib. lus ćha- bar byed-pa yino; arāṃdāṃ ‘inflammation’ Ⅰ 185, 105v2 u jsahira arāṃdāṃ jiṃda ‘it removes inflammation in the belly’, BS dāha-śamana-, possibly *arāvantāka- from base ar- ‘to burn’, IE Pok. 28 al-. For –āṃda-, note also urāṃda- ‘pregnant’ from udarāvant-. See also rauḍa-.

[DKS] ‘spotless’, K 62, 76v1 arīmä with variant K 53.9.2 agaṃjsa- ‘faultless’; dyadic Manj.347 arīma, avasve; adj. arrīmajsa- ‘clean’, SuvP. 69r3 arīmajsa, BS nirmala-; v 15, 1b3 ata arrīmajse; v 303, 02b2 vasvetī arrīmajsä ttaraṃdarä himi ‘ he has a pure spotless body (-ī himi ‘is to him’). Base rai-:rī-, see rrīman- ‘dirt’.

[DKS] ‘stinking’, Sid. 153r4 u ariśe’ bauśa hame ‘and bad smell occurs’, BS gūthaka-, Tib. dri mnam-pa yino; Sid. 140v2 arīśai’ va bauśä hame, Tib. kha-dri mi źim-pa ‘mouth smell not pleasant’; Ⅲ 123.61 arīśa’ satta, BS virūpa-satva-; Ⅲ 124.76 thāṃṣ̄ arīśa’ bījaisą., BS ttava vīrupa kathaiyasī ‘you speak ill’. See rrīśą ‘appetite’, BS ruci- ‘desire’, base raiz-.

[DKS] ‘remedy’ plural to aruvā- ‘remedy, medicament’ (with -ū < -va < -vä < -ve); note drabāḍū plural from drabāḍva ‘of the three times’, Manj. 316-17 dāvīje arrū prrabāvna naṣa’mārai harbaiśa sañe ‘by force of the dharma-medicine, all concepts are made quiescent’.
[DKS] ‘not broken’, v 64.42 balaudi ūstānä arūnai hu<.> sidhavaṃdī padīmi ‘I will make him strong, upright, sound, well- .., successful’. From a-rugnaa-, base raug-:rug ‘break’. See narūj-.

[DKS] ‘plant name’
[SVK] arka-kṣira, the resin (Sanskrit rasa, kṣirä, gala) of the mudar tree (Sanskrit arka).[Emmerick,Ⅰ,p.17]
[DKS] ‘youth, boy, son (of a king)’, alysānai, alysānei, inst. sing, alysānaina

[DKS] ‘pathless’. See paṃde.
[SVK] avamdāyą, is not an adjective meaning ‘pathless’ but locative sg. of a noun *avaṃde ‘on a non-path’.[Kumamoto,Ⅱ,p.20]

[DKS] ‘unafflicted’, K 60, 34V2 khu aśtą biśvā sarva-dharmvā avarūsye ‘so that he is in all dharma-elements unaffected’ (aśtą, not ra śtą); K 6, I45V3 avarrū<ṣy>au (sa)lāvyau ‘with unaffected words’, Tib. hphags-pahi tha-sñad ‘noble talk’, Chin. = BS ārya-caryā; translation E. Lamotte 252 nobles modes de parler. From a- ‘ not’ and parrūṣya- ‘subject affliction’, see parrūṣka-, BS kleśa-.

[DKS] ‘not sent, non-commissioned (?)’, Ⅳ 33b1 śe hvaṃḍye 260 mūri paśā avaśāna ‘for each man 260 mūrā- coins, commissioned, non-commissioned’; Ⅳ 52a2 stūra pajīṃdä paśā avaśāna daśe hvaṃdāṃ ‘they demand stūra-cattle, commissioned, non-commissioned, of ten men’, see SDTV 3; 1123.19.2paśa avaśāna hvaṃḍi himya; Ⅱ 20, 12b2 ttī jsā<ṃ> paśā avaśāna cirāṣṭa ‘then commissioned, non-commissioned to Cira’. See paśāta- ‘sent’.

[DKS] ‘studying’ (with locative), Ⅲ 100.9 from abi-ah-, abi-šta- base ah- ‘ throw, put ’ or possibly ah- ‘ to be ’ abi- ah- ‘ be absorbed in’, Orm. aw-, infinitive awōk, and haw-, participle hištak ‘to read’ from abi-ah- and abi-šta-. See the full text s.v. śvrrai.
[DKS] ‘not departing, permanent’, K 148.61-2 pārśa’ pajsaṃ avaṣṭaga caḍāve ‘may he practise continuous worship, reverence’. From a- ‘not’ and paṣṭa- ‘depart’.
[DKS] ‘permanent’, Z 11.37 avaṣṭandai ṣī varata parāhä ‘the śīla- (moral rule) is permanent there’; Z 22.313 puña avaṣṭandā yande ‘he makes permanent merits (BS puṇya-)'. To paṣṭa- ‘depart’.
[DKS] ‘not fear, safety’, K 140.997 ava’ste haurākä ‘giver of security’; SuvP. 72r4 ave’sta, BS abhaya-; K 64, 81r2 ave’sta kīthe, abhaiyi-pūrä. See puva’sta- ‘fearing’.
[DKS] loan-word with -īnaa-, v 183, a4 avastīnai haurna ‘with non-vastu gift’.
[DKS] ‘ non-permanent, incohate’ 1 145, 54r4 cvaṃ avastya vaṣprrīśta ‘for whom the incohate thing disperses’. See vastya- s.v. vasta.
[DKS] ‘not pure’, Manj. 347 śe śāmai vasve arīma śe śāme avasve saitta ‘of one mouth the pure seems foul, of one mouth it seems impure’. See vasuta- ‘purified’.

[DKS] ‘pathless’, K 110.338-9 daśau dīśau jsa hāṣṭa baysuña- vuysā ttsvāda avahā ttye baiśa hāṣṭa ‘ from the ten regions the bodhisattvas went there by air into the house’. Rather Prakrit from BS apatha- with -ka- ‘without a path’, hence ‘through the pathless air’. But possibly paθ- as Av.paθō-.
[DKS] ‘unchecked ’, K 50.5.4 raida-pāda tta maṃ hamāṃde avahīyi tvari bījairma ‘may they have the ṛddhi-pādas so, here,unchecked, very excellent’. See pahīya- from pahej-.
[DKS] ‘ lack of base ’, K 68.187, avārihā K 68.213. See pārahā.
[DKS] ‘unbased’, Ⅲ 24, 20a3 avārauttä aysmū, BS apratiṣṭhitam cittaṃ, K 60,38r2 avārāṃtta-; Manj. 149 avārātta. See pārautta-.
[DKS] ‘inconceivable ’, SuvP. 70VI ttiṣṭīmä kalpa avāṣṭa, BS tiṣṭheya kalpāni adntiyāni ‘ may I persist through inconceivable kalpa-ages ’. See akāṣṭa- from käṣ-: kāṣṭa- ‘ to think ’.
[DKS] ‘not seeing, blind’, fem., v 387.48 avījsyaca strrīya ‘blind woman’; K 46.37 ttye avijsyace strrīyi jsahera ‘in the womb of that blind woman’.

[DKS] ‘blind’, masc., JS 3IV3-4 avījsyamdā ysāḍaka dva mārā-pyara ‘ blind two old parents ’; K 46.47 pūra avījsyadai ysā ‘the son was born blind’; K 47.54 ṣi’ avījsyade ṣīrka ‘ the blind child’; Manj. 9 hana avījsyadai satva ‘blind, not seeing, being’ (dyadic). See vijsäṣ-.

[DKS] ‘not speaking’, v 343, 85v2 samu avätāye- mate jsa āre ‘they sit silent’, BS G 37, 80a3 tūṣṇīṃ-bhāvena-adhivāsayanti, Tib. čaŋ mi smra-bar hkhod-pa, beside v 343,85v5 samu apätāyāme jsa, BS G 37,80a6 tūṣṇīṃ-bhāvena-adhivāsayanti. See avyāya, to pätāy- ‘to speak’,
[DKS] ‘invisible (?) ’, K 60, 37V4 ne śaṃdya paremāṇavyā avīmeṃ jsāte ‘ does not go invisibly into the earth with the atoms’. See āvīda, to base vai-(n)- ‘to see’.

[DKS] ‘stoneless (?)’, 11 66.2-3 ttye pracaina cä bugura maṃdūsäna śaṃdā gärye avīmya gaṃtsa kūḍai vīra ‘ because Bugura bought land from Maṃdūsa, stoneless (?), with hole (and) pit’. See bīma- ‘rock, stone’, Av.vaēma-,Parth. Insc. vēm, Armen, vēm. See s.v. kūṣḍa-; SDTV 58.

[DKS] ‘best’, K 66, 84v3 ba’ysūśtä bautta avīrmā- ttama hvāṣṭä ‘he realizes the supreme excellent bodhi-knowledge’; K 59, 33r4 ttye käṇą mī byāṃdāṃdi tvā avīrmāttame ra(ṣṭa) ba’ysāna ba’ysūśtą, biśvā sarva-dharmā bīysāṃda ‘therefore they got that supreme Buddhas’ bodhi-knowledge awakened in all dharma-elements’; II 102.23 avīrmāttama be’ysāna be’ysūś’tä bausta hamye hamau-manai ‘may we become awakened to the best Buddhas’ bodhi-knowledge’, rendering BS anuttara-. See pīrmā-ttama- ‘best’.

[DKS] ‘undivided’, v 265, Dum 7b3 u aväṣkälstu pra-täha///; Ⅲ134,3a5 aväṣkälsto hīśäḍośtu därysde; K 57,26r1 aviṣkesta lakṣaṇä; K 60,36v4 vasva aviṣkesta lakṣaṇa; K145, 3r3-4 avaiṣkesta(-ṣk-, not -sk-). See päṣkal- ‘to separate’. avīsadai‘not returning’, =BS avaivartika-, anāgāmin-, Ⅲ 113, 4r3; K 92-48. See atīsandaa-, iīsedai.
[DKS] ‘priceless’, JS 33r4 phare raṃne avīha ‘many priceless jewels’, JS I4Ⅱ avīhyau ramnyo ‘with priceless jewels’; Ⅲ 58.16 avīhä:, BS anargha-. See pīha- ‘price’, BS mūlya-, and āra- ‘value’.

[DKS] ‘unchecked’, K 59, 3IV4 ba’ysuñavuysai asaṃkhistä ṣṭe avihī ‘the bodhisattva is untouched (unsmeared), unchecked’; K 58, 28r3 varī aysmūtī anāvidhyāyi hame avīhī ‘on the spot his mind becomes untouched, unchecked’. See pahej-:pahīya- ‘to stop’, ipihī.

[DKS] ‘not overcome’, K 153-22 māryau jsa avurrdą ‘ not overcome by Māras ’ = BS ajita-; K 52.7.3 avaurrdä; v 107, 29v3 avurde īsāre ‘they withdraw without conquest’, BS pramathaka- ‘repulser’; v 113, 35Ⅱ avurda hämāre ‘they are unconquered’, BS anavamardita-. See purr-:purrda- ‘to fight’.
[SVK] Bailey, quoting SuvK. 29v3 KT 5.107 [Suv 61.62] avurde īsāre, surprisingly assigns the meaning ‘without conquest’ to avurde instead of ‘unconquered, not overcome’ as elsewhere.
The passage from Suv runs as follows: gyastānu u aysurāṇu rraśma bva’lstānu umāvu purroṣca hämäte . u aysurāṇu nyauṣca . patājāmata tcamäna ttäte hīne biśe avurde, isāre, which means ‘for you (the Four Great Kings), having ridden into the battle between gods and asuras, there will be victory, and for the asuras (there will be) defeat (and) patājāmatā- (= ?) from which these armies will all return unconquered’. (The Skt text corresponding to patājāmata ... isāre is unfortunately corrupt and sheds no light on the Khotanese text, nor do the Tibetan and Chinese translations contribute to its understanding.)
At p. 204 s. v. patājāmata, Bailey translates ttäte hīne as ‘those armies’, which is probably why he feels obliged to translate avurde ‘without conquest’. However, ttäte means ‘these’, and here ttäte hīne must mean ‘these (our) armies’, which of course are the ones to return ‘unconquered’.[Skjsærvø, I, p.17]
[DKS] ‘unafraid’, v 41, a4 avuva’sta tsīnd<ä> ‘they go safely’. See puva’sta- ‘fearful’.

[DKS] ‘unheroic (?)’, Ⅲ 104-34 kṣūna mauḍū naradū avai’danya nairamāna ma vāṃ sāṣṭā ‘dying of hunger I went out feeling unheroic (?); in going out I (fem.) looked (=spāṣṭā) upon you here(=mara vā-ū)’. From the context and from possible connexion with vad- ‘to thrust’ in Oss. bädän- in DI. bädäjnag ‘heroic (man, woman, horse)’ from ‘impetuous’, with Oss. bädän ‘membrum virile’, base vad- in Av. vādāya-.
[DKS] ‘lack of fear’, K 64, 8Ⅳ2 avesta kīthe, abhaiyi-pūrä ‘in the city of safety’, dyadic; K 29.183-4 khu ra parśta avesta ‘so that he escape unafraid’. See avuva’sta, avasta-, from puva’d-.
[DKS] ‘speechless’, Manj. 415-16 pyāstāda avyāya satva ‘the dumb beings spoke’, variant Z 5-101 u muta pätāstu yäḍāndä ‘and the dumb could speak’. See pätāy-.
[DKS] ‘not speaking’, JS 18v3 nvastä avyāyaṃdai buy’sä ‘he lay silent long time’. See pätāy-.
[DKS] ‘not speaking’, Ⅲ 60.36-7 avyāyāme jsa simāhāṃ vī ṇe’stä ‘he sat without speaking in a samādhāna- trance’. See avätāyemate jsa, from pätāy- ‘to speak’.

[DKS] ‘not stated’, Ⅲ 28, 38b3-4 jaḍa haḍa ṣṭā kūra māsāre avyāsta ṣa’ dharma mūkhau jsa jaḍau prahajañau jsa (hvata ?) ‘however the ignorant (BS jaḍa-) accept the false things, not spoken; this is stated as dharma-doctrine by fools (BS mūrkha-) by ignorant laymen’, BS sa ca bāla- prthagjanair udgṛhītaḥ; Ⅲ 28, 39a3-4 ttina gyasta ba’ysäna hvata avyāstä dharma jaḍyau prahujañau jsa hvata ‘the dharma-doctrine, not taught, spoken by the deva Buddha is stated by the ignorant laymen to be false’. To pätāsta-; = BS anirvacanīya- ‘ineffable’.
[DKS] ‘not heard’, K 1, I35v2 ne avyūṣṭu pyūṣḍe ‘hears not the unheard’; Z 2 -117 niśtä avyūṣṭä adäte avaysāndäkari ‘is not unheard, unseen, unknown at all’. See apyūṣṭa-.

[DKS] ‘intolerable, severe’, Sid. 12r5 ttarä hīvī āchai avyauca na’heje ‘removes the intolerable disease of thirst’, Tib. skom-pahi nad mi bzad-pa źi-bar byed-de (elsewhere Tib. mi bzad-pa renders BS dāruṇa-); Sid. 100r3-4 dvyā kve’ysvā vī avyauca vīna himāre ‘ in both sides severe pains occur’; K 31.27 avyauca baida āvūṃ mar a ṣṭānä pahaiyi ‘ (taxes) intolerable were laid on them, from here, they fled’, =K 15.117 ttaña kṣīra daura(ba)kṣa pasta tvara avyaucha ‘in the country famine occurred exceedingly severe’, =K 23.72-3 avatca vī āva bīhī kīḍa bara jasta skadaka śā śā mara ṣṭāna pahaiya ‘ (taxes) were laid on them, intolerable exceedingly, O king, one by one they fled hence secretly’. Also avyāca, Ⅲ 106.24 tta brīvīnai be-vūḍa pūna ysaira baida baista avyāca ‘ so love’s poisoned arrows intolerable pierced the heart’, see SDTV 30; Ⅱ 40.36-7 dakhu kāra avyāca baye haysgama ‘misery, torment (BS kāraṇa-), intolerable fear, grief’. Without negative Ⅱ 2.19 haṃdarāṃ jsāṃ vyaucą yanīdą. ‘they make tolerable to others’. See pyauea ‘counter-action, remedy’ for the connexions.

[DKS] aśa-‘horse’, V 115, 64V2 aśśa märāre ‘horses die’, BS mṛtābhikṣṇaṃ priyāśvāś ca; Sid. I02v5 aśä ‘horse’, Tib. rta; v 236.23 aśa salya ‘in the Horse year’. Compound Z 13.25 śäte ju aśśa-bārai āya ‘the second may be the horse-rider’. Epithets of the horse are in Ⅲ 72.167-8 hūvathāta tcarṣva ttuṃna ‘well-caparisoned, handsome, stout’. From *aśṷa-, direct to aśśa- (as Waxī yaš), Av. aspa-, O.Pers. asa- (to N.Pers. sa- in suvār), Sogd.M. Pers.T. ’sp, Zor.P., N.Pers. asp, Oss.D. äfsä, I. jäfsä ‘mare’, D. äfsikko ‘mare’, with -äfs in the compound xärg- äfs ‘mule’ (‘ass-horse’), Waxī yaš, Pašto ās. For ‘rider’,N. Pers. suvār, Zor.P.asaβār, O.Ind. lw aśvavāra-. IE Pok. 301.2, O.Ind. áśva-, Lat. equos, Got. aihwa-, O. Engl. eoh, Celt. Gaul epo-, Ir. ech, Tokhara B yakwe, A yuk. See also aśya ‘cavalry’.

[DKS] ‘non-duality’, Manj. 87 ttuśāttā ttathatta aśa’ña ‘the void, suchness, unity’, beside K 55,17r4 śā’mña jsa ‘with duality’; K 58, 29r3 cu vara śā’mñä na daittą ‘where duality is not seen’. See duva ‘two’, śäta- ‘second’, later śe’; aśa’ña ‘non-duality’.
[DKS] ‘without holes,knots’Z 23-44, Chinese kien-mi ‘compact’ (K 369.2; 617.2). Base śṷambh- to śṷabh- in O.Ind. śvabhra- ‘hole’, Zor.P. sūrāk ‘hole’.

[DKS] ‘sharp, flinty, stony’,Ⅲ 79.10 bvaiysä aśäjä satharä dūrä ttī jsāṃ sagūḍä ‘ long flinty slope, hard, then also stony’. From as- ‘to be sharp’, IE Pok. 19-20 ak̂-, O.Ind. aśáni- ‘arrow-point, thunderbolt’ (> Khotan Saka lw aśuna-), Greek ἃκανος‘thorn’. Here *aśan-či- with dialectal -ś- kept. See s.v. śśära- ‘good’.
[DKS] ‘unhurt (?) ’, v 145,11765-6 ///maśā aśūla harya///ga se mū va aśūla///. See aśau’laka ‘unhurt’.

[DKS] ‘plant name, BS kaśeruka-, scirpus kysoor ’ (Lat. scirpus ‘bulrush’), Sid. 18r4. Base *as-ya- ‘sharp, pointed’, to as-:s-‘to sharpen’, with Av. asūra-‘point’, Oss. D. änsurä ‘tusk’, I. ssyr, Sogd.B. ’ns’wr, BS danta- ‘tusk’. IE Pok. 18-22 O.Ind. śiśāti: śita- ‘to sharpen’.

[DKS] ‘unharmed (?)’, Ⅱ 80.12 ṣą mä aysdārä aśau’laka svahaka ‘this my supporter, unharmed (?), safe’. Base zai-:zi- ‘to injure’ with śa’- from zya-, Av. zyāni-, Zor.P. zyān, N.Pers. ziyān. Armen, lw zean. Suffix -laka- as in Sid. 151r1 śikalaka, Tib. legs-par ‘well’, and agalaka ‘ limb ’ to aṃga-. Here dyadic with svahaka-.

[DKS] ‘perhaps’, Ⅲ 70-109 paṃmarai bvīrau aśka ‘perhaps you know a report of her’; v 339, 77r3 aśka auṣṭe gyasta ‘perhaps the deity is angered’, BS G 37, 72b7 deva-krodham hi te bhavet, Tib. rab-tu ‘greatly’. From older asti with ka (Av. asti, kadā). For aśtä ka, note V 333, 27r3 aśtä ko se kuṃjsati t<t>īma pharākä hämäta, BS G 37, 2424 bahūni tasya bījāny utpadyeran. See aścä, aśte ‘is there ...?’.
[DKS] ‘is there...?’, K 32.32 aśte ī ‘is it perhaps. . . ’; v 244, 1b3 pasti sa aścä, =K 94.96 pasta hva sa aśta. . . ‘he spoke saying, Is there. . . ?’; 11 10-161 aścai kaiṇa.

[DKS] ‘existence’, K 54, I5VI aśti jsa ttuśāttā, naiścä jsa ttūśāttā, =BS samskṛta-śūnyatā, asaṃskṛta-śūnyatā; K 53.9.4-5 aśti naiśte jsa pahaiṣṭä ‘without existence (and) non-existence’; K 67.168-9 aśte jsa aśtu khu jīye ‘how existence is destroyed by existence’; Manj. 320 nai aśta ‘exists not’ (but niśtä ‘is not’). See BS asti-nāsti-bhāvaḥ. From older asti, Tumšuq asti, Av. asti to base ah- (as- before -t-).
[DKS] ‘it is’ with pronoun, Ⅱ 101-244 na ra ma stūrä aśtą na bai’da pamūhą ‘ there is no longer for me beast, not clothes upon me’ (ma. . .aśtą ‘I have’).

[DKS] ‘what’, Ⅲ 123.59 aśtū vai kṣamai, BS kiṃ kṣamati ‘what pleases you?’; Ⅱ 52.6 parau na ā sa khve tcerai aśtū-ṃ āṃ ya ‘ a command did not come how you (-e) should act, what to do with them (-ṃ) ’; Ⅱ 52.8 pvesīda sa aśtū ā yaṃdą ‘they ask, What are you doing?’; Ⅱ 85*13 viña ra ttā aśtū pharākä ttūśā silāta haṣḍi yine ‘ now also I make report as to many empty words’; II 7*118 aścū gvaṣṭaiysathūā ‘ (what) have you been separated in births ? ’ See also haiśtū.

[DKS] ‘horse’s fodder, lucerne’, Ⅲ 73.184 aśa ra aśpara hvaḍāṃdä ‘the horses ate lucerne’; Ⅱ124.86 aśpara, BS yāṃga asana (? yoga-aśana-); Z 13.91 rrusa aśpari ‘barley, horse’s fodder’; compound Ⅳ, 60a3 aśpara-barā ‘carriers of lucerne’. From *aśśa-para- (early type of compound like biś-paḍā ‘first of all’) to base par- ‘to feed’, pres. pār-: pāḍa- ‘to nourish, rear’. For lucerne Akkadian aspastu, asupastu, aspasti, Kroraina aśpista-, Zor.P.,N. Pers. aspast, Aram, ’spst-’, Syriac ’spst-’, pstst’-, Arab. fuṣṣ, fuṣfuṣah.
[DKS] ‘cavalry’, Manj. 138 aśya hasty a gūha rahya tc(ü)ra- ysanya hīna ‘four-membered army, cavalry, elephants, infantry, chariotry’. Adjective to aśśa- ‘horse’.
[DKS] ‘not attached’, Ⅱ 115.31 BS lw Kroraina aṣajamaṇa, Pali asajjamāna-, BS aṣajyamāna- to base BS ṣang- (O.Ind. sang-) ‘attach’, see the full text s.v. khāśā’nvā.

[DKS] ‘indolence’, K 3, 139v1-2 aṣarrāmata hämäta, Tib. źum-pa ‘fear, despondency’, Chinese hi-tai-sin ‘with indolent mind’(K 366-3; 184-10; 801-1); E. Lamotte, translation ‘ découragement (līna-citta-)’. Base ṣṣarr-, Z 20-8 strīye daha āṣṣuḍa tsīndä ‘women and men go about excited’; Z 7.24 suhäna ṣṣarri klaiśa ‘by pleasure (BS sukha-) triumphs over kleśa-afflictions’. The conjunct ṣṣ -is from š-, χš-,fš-, equivalent to O.Ind. kṣ-, ps-. Possibly O. Ind. psar- archaic equivalent to mad- ‘be excited’ (BSOAS 21, 1958, 543). See also ysīta-, iysīye.

[DKS] ‘pigeon’ Z 20.16 tcīrauka daindä duva assänaka ‘two ducks are seen, pigeons’; JS 34r2 aṣṇake; Ⅱ 80.25 aṣanai; Sid. 17r5 āṣai aṣṇai, BS hārīta-, Tib. phug-ron sŋon-po ‘blue pigeon’, plural Ⅲ 35.32 aṣṇā; compound Sid. 142v4 aṣṇūha ‘ dung of pigeons’ (*axśaina-gūθa-). To Oss. D. äxsinängä, DI. äxsinäg ‘dove’ (TPS 1945.6); Tokhara B ekṣinek in the adjective ekṣinekaṃñana misa ‘flesh of pigeon’. See also āṣṣeiṇa- from *axšaina- ‘blue’.
[DKS] ‘eternal’, K 60, 35r1 askāṃjsya jsīna byehe ‘he gets eternal life’, seeoṣkāṃjsya-, āṃṣkāmjsya.

[DKS] ‘untouched’, Z 13-114 cu vara bīnāña aṣkusta adaunda ṣṭāna akrīya ‘what there (=where) music untouched, unblown, unbeaten’; Manj. 414 bīnāña aṣkūstai ṣṭāna pīhyāda ramanī hvara ‘ music untouched, they beat ( = sound) delightful, sweet’, Base skau-:sku- ‘to touch, play a musical instrument’.
[DKS] ‘not abusing’, V Ⅲ, 33v1 aniyaśśu aṣṭakulcu, BS abhaṇḍana-. See ṣṭakula- ‘abuse’.

[DKS] asamkhista- ‘unsmeared, unpolluted’, Z 6.22 daśyau baśdyau jsa asaṃkhälstu ‘undefiled by the ten sins’; Z 6.39 klaiśyau jsa asaṃkhilstä; K 60,36v2 biśām upakleśā’m vāysañāṃ o’syāṃ asaṃkhistą, ṣṭe ‘is undefiled by all smaller afflictions (BS upakleśa-), influences (BS vāsanā), desires (olsa-)’; Manj. 171 asakhe’sta sakhuja veysa ‘undefiled like the lotus ’; K73.34 asakhista sa khū ji rana ‘undefiled like a jewel’; K 55,17r4 śāṃ’ña jsa asaṃkhistä ṣṭe ‘is undefiled by duality’; K 54, 13v3 svabhāvna asaṃkhistä ‘undefiled by nature’; K59, 31v4 asaṃkhistä ṣṭe avi’hī ‘undefiled it is, unchecked’. Parallel to Pali anulitto lokena toyena padumaṃ yathā ‘ unsmeared by the world as the lotus by water’. See saṃkhal-.
[DKS] ‘foeless’, V 113, 35v1 asānä īṇete hlñe jsa anṛhīyä ‘without enemy, unoppressed by a foreign army’, from negative and sāni ‘enemy’.
[DKS] ‘impure’, Ⅲ 123.66 asūrai, BS aśuci-; Sid. 125vI asurai ‘unclean’, BS amedhya-, Tib. mi gčaŋ. See suraa- ‘pure’ (*suxraka-).
[DKS] ‘not burnt’, Sid. 153v2 khu ri va asuva śau beṣṭarą bāgara harśtä ‘so that one layer of leaf remains unburnt’, Tib. lo-ma naŋ-rim ma ćhig ćam-du bsregs-nas, see sūjs-: sūta-.

[DKS] ‘slow, slow-witted’, equivalent to BS jaḍa-‘foolish’, Z 5.14 hvate balysä hvī’yä ūtamo ysaṃthä käḍe asottāña kyai tta jändä ‘the Buddha taught a parable about human birth (BS upamā); they are very slow who destroy it so’, because hard to reach. From *saub-:sotta- to Sogd. Bud. swδ swδ’n ‘swiftly’, IE Pok. 954 skeu- ‘of speed’, Lit. šáuju, šáuti ‘throw (› shoot)’, šũvis ‘shot’, šáudyti ‘make throw about, shoot often’, O.Slav. sujǫ, sovati ‘shove’. Beside IE Pok. 954 (s)heu- with increments, Pok. 955 -bh-, -d-, skeubh- see s.v. anāskotta-, haskautta-, to O.Ind. códati ‘drive, force’, N.Pers. čust ‘swift’. See also biśautta- ‘hackled’ from saub-. Suffix -āna- with -ya-.
[DKS] ‘up’, Ⅲ 70.107 naṇḍa makala aska jsā rruśta ‘the monkey Naṇḍa got the chieftainship’. See uska ‘up’.

[DKS] ‘put back’, Ⅲ 93-261 <da>dä jṣā’ñāñä khu śva’ jīye ttī askināñä paskyāṣṭä hāñāṣṭä, ysūnāñä ‘ so much is it to be cooked that half is gone, then it must be put back into the vessel, it must be strained’. From us- and kan- ‘to place’,

[DKS] ‘arise, issue’, Ⅱ 2.20 askhaṃjsa (SDTV 30); Sid.7v1 iskhajsä, BS abhyudaya- ‘rising’; Ⅱ 123 (4091).6 askhijsye apvenye bāḍä ‘prosperous secure time’; with -āmatā-, III 64-21 askhajsāme, II 85.Ⅱ askhijsāme. See uskhajs-.

[DKS] ‘eminence, protuberance’, Sid. 138r4 sai’kä cu askhaukara hame, BS utsedha- ‘protuberance’; Sid. 143r3 ni riysauttä askhaukarīyāvai ri va ni hamä vasve baustä ṣṭe ‘ it no longer flows; also it does not become a protuberance; it is known to be clean’, BS na cotsanna-, Tib. rlo-ba med-pa rnams yin-te (rlo-ba =hphyaŋ-ba ‘hang down’). From us- ‘up’ with base kauk-, as in Lit. kaukarà‘hili’, IE Pok. 589 keu-k-.

[DKS] ‘move up’, Ⅲ 104.44-6 śada ka bīnamīye brrī satta vahanī ā vāvai jīyi drai ai’ha: askhāysī hamāra brra hvanda ugvaysāra avīpa, = Ⅲ 108-4-5 śaṃda ka bīnämāve brrī satta vahanī ā vā vāvai jī<yi drai ai’ha: askh>auysī, hamārä brra sattu gvaysārä avīpa ‘ if the earth should split, the beloved man sink in, or for him life of three stages end; beings become amorous, yet they part assuredly’ (avīpa, BS avikalpaṃ).
[DKS] ‘top’, Sid. I53V4, Tib. śiŋ-buhi thor-to, see ysihe, Tib. thor-to.

[DKS] ‘at last’, Ⅱ 94.16 astaṃ āvą ‘they came at last, = Ⅱ 96.99 ąsta āvą; K 30.205-6 astavai brraạṭā heś(t)ü tta dyāya ‘at last she asked her, Did you see anything?’, = K 38-140 tvāysādi brrastā haiśtū tta dyāyi ‘she asked the old woman, Did you see anything?’. See ustama-.

[DKS] astān- ‘to stretch’, Ⅲ 34.12-13 khū ja bīna astana ‘as one tunes the hīnā-instrument’, = Ⅲ 36.8 khu ja bīna astāna. Infinitive Ⅲ 40-16 khu bīnä skīdä astāmdä ‘as they touch the bīnā-instrument to tune it’. From us-tan- Av. ustāna- ‘up-stretched’, N.Pers. tanīdan ‘to stretch’, IE Pok. 1065-6 ten- ‘stretch’, O.Ind. tanoti, tatá-, Greek τἀνυται, τείνω, τατός . See also thana-, ttaṃga-, ttanv-.

[DKS] ‘to be’, as- before -t-
[SGS] ‘to be’ I a act. intr. B suppletive ppp. väta-
3 sg. Pres., O.Kh.: aśtä Z I. 37+; śtä Z 1. 36+.
3 pl. pres., O.Kh.: īndä Z 2. 135+.
2sg. pf. intr. m., O.Kh.: vätī Z 24. 246.
Et. 3 sg. pres, *asti: Av,, O.Ind. asti; Parth. ’st (Ghilain, p. 46), MPe ’st (Verhum, p. 167); Man., B. Sogd. ’sty, Chr. st̠y < *asti (I. G., GMS> § 87, p. 12). ppp. < *būta-: Av. būta-, O.Ind. bhūta-; cf. Waxī vī̌t < *būta-, IIFL, ii. 548 s.v. wōc-.[p.7]
[DKS] ‘unbroken’, Bcd 48n, BS akhaṇḍa-; ahatcastūm ‘unbroken for me’, Ⅳ 23.8 ahatcastūṃ mūñī ‘may (the vow) remain for me unbroken’. See hatcan-.
[DKS] ‘without hostility’, Ⅴ Ⅲ, 33v1 ahaṃdrūṣṣu aggūrāsu, BS avigrahāya avivādāya. See haṃdrūṣṣa-.
[DKS] ‘without change’, Sid. 7r5 ahamici jsai kāña krravī tcerai ‘without change it must be kept, the treatment of it must be carried out’, Tib. mi hgyur-bar bsruŋ-bahi čho-ga byaho. See hamista-.

[DKS] ‘unchanged’, JS 4v1 sūmīrä garä māñamdä ahamistä akhāṣṭä ‘like Sumeru mountain unchanged, unmoved’; K 63, 78r3 aysmū ahamistą akhaustä ‘the mind unchanged, unmoved’; Sid. 7v1 cuai hauva ahamaista he (variant hame) ‘for whom the strength is unchanged’, Tib. sñiŋ stobs ni mi hgyur-ba byed-pa-ste.
[DKS] ‘abusive’, JS 8v4 ahamñe ysīre hve ttrikṣa salāta ‘abusive, harsh, sharp words he spoke’. From Prakrit to adhimanya-.

[DKS] ‘undisturbed’, SuvP. 60v2 śye ṣīvi ahaṃphiḍä śāna, hūña dyai haḍara ba’ysa, BS eka-rātram atandritena svapnāntaraṃ gataṃ mayā ‘one night lying undisturbed I saw in a dream former Buddhas’. See haṃphīr-.

[DKS] ‘unsuitable’, Sid. 8v4-5 ahaṃbusana hvaḍa khaṣṭa patsāñä ‘unsuitable foods and drinks must be avoided’, Tib. kha-zas mi hphrod-pa de-dag spaŋs-la; Sid. 8v4 ahaṃbusanāṃ hvadāṃ khaṣṭāṃ jsa. See haṃbusana-.

[DKS] ‘not arisen, non-extant’, K 112.381 cu baiśa hara ahamya bvādai ‘who may know all dharma-elements to be non-existent’; Manj. 2 ahamye aje naṣau’da ‘non-existent, not perished, quietened’. Older ahämäta-.

[DKS] ‘without trouble’, v 113, 35r1 (dyadic) ahaysgamatu u anuvadräta hämāre, BS anupasargāṇy anupāyāsāni ca; v 113, 35v1 u ahaysgamatä ahvarīysätä (variant aharīysätä), BS anupasargaṃ cānupāyāsaṃ ca. See haysgamata.
[DKS] ‘unwashed’, Ⅲ 85.75 ahaysnāva ysaraṃjsą, Ⅲ 90.182 ahaysnāvä ysaraṃjsä ‘unwashed safflower (carthamus tinctorius)’. See haysnāta-.
[DKS] ‘unpresented’, Ⅳ 55a2 aharaṣṭa ysārä drrai-se haudā mūri ‘not presented, 1370 mūrā-coins’. See haraṣṭa-.

[DKS] ‘with none left out, total’, Bcd 50v1 aharīna, BS aśeṣatah, Sid. 130r1 beti jsa āchā aharīna biysānā harbeśä jidä ‘dispels all severe diseases arising from wind’, Tib. rluŋ-nad-kyis ñam-thag-pa thams-čad sel-ba yin-no; v 247, 14b1 aharīna, BS sakala-samāpta-.
[DKS] ‘total’, Sid. 133r3 cu buri saṃ aharīnaka vā-śerū hamāte ‘whatever may be total gout (BS vāta-śoṇita-)’, Tib. dreg-go-čog-la ni.
[DKS] ‘without trouble’, BS anupāyāsa-, reported as a variant to v 113, 35v1 ahvarīysätä.

[DKS] ‘uninterrupted’, Sid. 146v5 aharṣṭä bijsāñä, Tib. rgyun-tu blugs-na, ‘to be poured without stopping’; Bcd 49v3 aharṣṭa, BS sarve ‘all’. Later ahaṣṭa-, Ⅲ 127.7 ahaṣṭa sakra varttai ‘he continuously practises reverence (BS satkriyā-). See harṣṭa-.
[DKS] ‘not forgetting’, v 185, 2b4 kye byātarji ahāmurji vä<tä>, dyadic.
[DKS] ‘not forgetfulness’, K 2, 135v2-3 ahāmurgyatete käḍanai; K 7, 148r4 ahāmurgyatetīnā päga’, Tib. mi brj̆ed-pahi stobs ‘power of not forgetting’. See ahaumaurrjä, From hāmura-.

[DKS] ‘quarry, wild beast’, Ⅲ 68.79 ssa-tci’ṃma’ña ahāvi jsyāṃde ‘they killed the 100-eyed quarry’, parallel Rāmāyana mṛgān ‘deer’. From ah- ‘to shoot’, *ahāta- ‘to be shot’, like hasūra- ‘quarry’ from *fra-saura- ‘to be hunted ’, and jsīñaa- ‘ to be slain, criminal condemned’.

[DKS] ‘plant name’, Ⅲ 92.238 ū ahi: ṣi’ vą dāttä ‘the ahi: plant, that is the dāttä-plant’; Ⅰ 183, 102r5 dāttī, BS daṃttī (dantī); Sid. 14r4 dattä hīya bāta ‘root of danti-’, BS danti-, Tib. dandahi rća-ba (rća-ba ‘root’). Possibly ahi- to base ah- ‘to cut’ hence ahi: ‘cutting tool’, as mechanical translation of BS danti(n)- ‘toothed, jagged’ (as khuysaa- for BS mandūkī, and hva-khāṃdala- for BS āruka- from āru- ‘boar’). Then base anh-:ah- ‘to cut’, ahi- ‘cutting tool, sword’, to Av. aŋhū- (ablative Yašt 13.46 aŋhuyāṯ) and O.Ind. así- ‘sword, knife’, Lat. ēnsis ‘sword’ (where base anh- is like kart- ‘to cut’, Av. karəta- ‘sword’, see kāḍara-). BS danti(n)- is baliospermum montanum.

[DKS] ‘not one’s own’, K 154.41-2 ahīye hera nāsāmi ‘taking not one’s own’, the BS śikṣāpada- command adattādāna- ‘taking things not given’; Z 12.64 ihivī heḍä ‘he gives not his own’. See i- =a- negative, and hivī.

[DKS] ‘not greed ’, v 38, 28b3 ///-ä ahīsa naunda himā<te?>/// See hīsa-.
[SVK] This is a privative bahuvrīhi compound ‘without greed, ungreedy’, not a noun as Bailey has it. [Skjærvø, Ⅰ, p.18]

[DKS] ‘unnumbered’, K 5, 142v3 ahumāru uy<sn>ora puñīnei nasta bāgyä handajāñätemä ‘I made unnumbered beings to ripen good roots of merit’, Tib. sems-čan maŋ-po dag dge-bahi rća-ba-la yos-su smin-par byas-so; K 2, 137v1 u ahumāru ṣä cu ne sīte śtä ‘uncounted that which he has not learnt’; v 156, 187v2 ahumāryau haysgamaty<au> ‘with unnumbered troubles’; Ⅰ 252, 1r5 <a>humāryau sīyau yseryau, BS śata-sahasra-; SuvO. 68v2 ahumāryau yseryau, BS sahasraneka. From mar-, ṣumar- ‘to count’, ṣumuḍa- ‘counted’.
[DKS] ‘elsewhere’, Manj. 222-3 mare mīḍe ahūlaña hīśta ‘he dies here, elsewhere he migrates’. See uholaña.

[DKS] ‘gourd’, Ⅱ 1.8 ahauḍa vastya; Sid. 18r2-3 ahoḍa, BS alabu-, Tib. ku-ba; Ⅲ 88.153 ttīrä ahauḍä hīya ṣarä ‘nut of bitter gourd’. See also byāra- BS ervāru-. Base vart- ‘to be round’, hence aha-vṛt-a-, with ūḍāra- ‘crystal’ and Waxī wurt, Kurd. bard ‘stone’ (JRAS 1955, 22), naming the gourd ‘round like the belly’.
[DKS] ‘not a gift’, Ⅲ 9,18r3 ttädi( = ttaṃdi) ahaura hauḍai ‘you gave such non-gifts’ beside Ⅲ 10, 19r5 hauri nä hauḍemä ‘I did not give a gift’. See base hor- ‘to give’.

[DKS] ‘weak’, Ⅴ 116, 65r7 ahovana u duṣpäta’, BS sudurbala-; later Ⅰ 163, 79r1 ysāḍa paskyāṣṭi cist a padīmi ahauvaṃ pijsa padīmi ‘it makes the old young again, it makes the weak strong’ (pijsa = päta’jsa-), See haut-, hot- ‘be able’.

[DKS] ‘noose’, Ⅴ 161, 35v2 ///ahväna baittä ‘is bound with a noose’, BS na ca sa tṛṣṇā-pāśa-baddho bhaviṣyati, Tib. sred-pahi źags-pas (BS pāśa-) bčiŋs-par mi hgyur-ro ‘he is not bound by the noose of desire’. See aha-, aha’-, inst. plur. ahyau. For -hv- note also ahva-, aha- ‘belly’.

[DKS] ‘belly’, as first component in ahva-rīysa- ‘fear’ from rrīys- ‘to tremble’ and ahva- ‘belly’, as the source of ‘fear’. See aha ‘belly’, and rrīys- ‘to tremble’. The meaning is from the use of a name of part of the body for the affection in that part, as O.Pers. uši ‘intelligence’ from uš- ‘ear’, Av. karəna- ‘ear’ and ‘deaf’, like Georgian qur-i ‘ear’ qru ‘deaf’, Megrel ‘uru ‘foolish’; Greek ἰσχἰον ‘hip’, ἰσχιἀς ‘pain in the hip’. Hence O.Pers. afuvā- ‘fear’, O.Ind. ápvā-, apvā ‘fear’, from the source ‘belly’. Note Al-Tha‘ālibī, Histoire, ed. H. Zotenberg 714 fa ashala ’l-xaufu baṭana-hu ‘and fear loosened his belly’. Similarly O.Ind. śaṣkulī ‘ear’, and ‘disease of hearing’.
[DKS] ‘not to be spoken’, in 73.188 mire a ahvañe ṣṭāna ‘I shall die since it is not to be spoken’. Base hvan- ‘to speak’, hvaña- ‘to be spoken’.
[DKS] ‘before eating’, Ⅰ 167, 83r4 ahvaḍāṃdī tharka masi hviri ‘as much as a walnut is to be eaten before taking food’. Base hvar- ‘to eat’.
[DKS] ‘not man’, Ⅴ 308, 9r1, BS amanuṣya- in the series from gods to goblins.
[DKS] ‘not men’, Ⅴ 257.6, 1b4 <hva>ndä ahvandä uvāra ‘men, not men, noble ones’. See hvand- ‘man’.

[DKS] ‘belly-shaking, fear’, SuvO. 4v2 haysgamata īyä o kā’ṣca u vadrava īyo gārīvä o puvaṇä o ahvarīysä īyä, BS śokāyāse ’py anarthe ca bhaya-vyasana eva ca, here corresponding to bhaya- ‘fear’. See aha-.

[DKS] ‘lack of fear’ (variant aharīysätä quoted by S. Konow, ed. to Ⅴ 113, 35v1). Possibly a subscript small a added before hva, hardly visible on the photograph, but reported by Konow. The scribe may have intended a- ‘not’ before ahva-rīysätä (instead of an- as in a-uysānā) or has wrongly written hva for -ha- in aharīysa- ‘not trembling’. The ending -ätä may represent either the suffix -ita-, or stand for -ä, as in Ⅴ 77, 145v5 viysäte ‘lotus’ for viysä, with buśānätai ‘scented’ for buśānai.

[DKS] ‘not produced, eternal’, Ⅲ 128.2-3 śukye ahvyāñe saṃtsāru baṃdani-śāl<e?> guchāme udiśāyi ‘for escape from the universal (one = universal) eternal transmigrational prison’. For the ‘prison’, v 126, b1 saṃtsārūṃ bārmina, BS saṃsāra-bhava-bandhanāt, Tib. lćon-ra, Tokhara B saṃsārṣṣe pele, and Jaina saṃsāra-cāraya-. Base hau-:hu- ‘to bear young’, hence parallel to BS aja- ‘not produced’ (see also ahämäta- ‘not arisen’); Av. hunu- ‘son’, hazaŋrō.huna-, haota-, hunahi, hunāmi, O.Ind. sū́te, sūtá-, sūnú-, Zor.P. hunušakēnītan, višūtakān, Form hvya-, as dvya- ‘to beat’, base dav-, IE Pok. 913-14 seu-:sū̆-. See also ṣū ‘son’.

[DKS] ‘or’, I 189, 111r2 rīysūtcana khāśā’ña ā mākṣī hīyi uca jsa ‘to be drunk with rice-water or with honey water’; JS 5r2 śägä (for śaṃgä) ā vā ṣvīdä, ā mīrāhīja karāśä a vā bora ‘conch, or milk or pearl spray or snow’. With vā also, Sid. 102r4 ā vā ṣvīnai ā vā hīśanai yaṃdrrä padīmāñä ‘a tool (BS yantra-) must be made either of horn or of iron’, Tib. rva ham, lčags-kyi sbubs. This ā replaces older o, au ‘or’ either as dialectal difference or phonetic development (cf. also loc. plur. -vo’, replaced by -vā) (to IE Pok. 75), Ⅳ 2.5 ā ni ‘or not’, see o ne.

[DKS] ‘he came’, participle = preterite 3 sing., from *āgata-, older ātä nom. sing. Ⅳ 6oa2 parau ā, ‘the command came’, fem. sing. Ⅱ 89.48 hīna āta ‘the army came’; plur. Ⅱ 126.19 hvaṇḍä āva, older Z 24.473 āta hämāre ‘they came’. Base gam-:gata-, IE Pok. 464-5 gu̯em-.

[DKS] ‘not’ in the word Sid. 5r2 āhvarai ‘sour’, Tib. skyur-ba, fem. Sid. 4v2 āhvarrja, Tib. skyur-ba, BS amla-, from hvara- ‘sweet’. The reverse is in Sogd. Man. n’mryẖ ẕ̆’r ‘sweet poison’; čn šhr’ n’mrtr ‘sweeter than sugar’ (W. B. Henning, BBB 45), from *an-āmra- ‘not sour’. See haṃga- from *am(a)ka- ‘sour’, to IE Pok. 777-8 om-. The short initial a- is replaced by ā- also in āṣṣeiṇa- ‘blue’.
[DKS] ‘towards’, preverb, see ācana, āta, āspar- and others; Av. ā-, a-, O.Ind. ā-, IE Pok. 280-1.
[DKS] ‘you’, suffixed pronoun, older -ū. See J. M. Dresden, Jātaka-stava, p. 412.
[DKS] ‘with thumb’, Z 22.305 inst. sing, from *anguštya-, beside haṃguṣṭa- ‘finger’, see āṣṭī.

[DKS] ‘painful’, Sid. 103r2 khaysma ākrre herä hame ‘abscess becomes a painful thing’, Tib. ñam-thag-pa byed-pahi phol-mig hbyuŋ-ste. From base (s)kar- ‘to cut’ to ā-(s)kṛta- or ā-(s)kṛya-.
[SVK] ākrre is the expected Late Khotanese form of Sanskrit ākṛti. It occurs also in P 2739.40 KT 2.86 mahaiśūra ą̄krrai dyainą ‘like Maheśvara in appearance’. It was recognised there by Bailey, Bulletin of the Deccan College Research Institute, XX. 1—4, 1960, 277. [Emmerick, Ⅰ, pp.19-20]

[DKS] ‘they begin’, Z 24.499; 3 sing. Z 4.15 ākṣūtä, Ⅲ 83.25 ākṣū jīye ‘begins to vanish’; Sid. 142r5 ākṣu byaśde’ ‘begins to mature’, Tib. ćha-ba-la; pret. Z 5.26 ākṣutte, 3 plur. SuvO. 68v7 bīnāña ākṣuttāndä yanä, BS pravādayanti ‘they began to sound music’; Manj. 405 ākṣya (ya = ü) daitta ‘he begins to see’ = Z 9.27 ākṣüti däyāna; ‘be seen’, Ⅲ 79.11 ragya jsä ākṣūṃ pāstāgä ‘from the bank I was tossed headlong’. See also nikṣūtä, nakṣautta-, kṣäv-, kṣautta-, prakṣautta-. Base xšaub- ‘to disturb’, Av. xšufsa-, M.Pers.T. ’’šwb ‘disturbance’, wšwb-, wyšwb-, wswb’g (He. Verbum 184; Mir.Man. 2.54); Zor.P. āšōp, āšuftak, višōpišn, višuftan, Armen, lw apšop, ašop, N.Pers. āsōb, āšuftan, gušuftan, Balōčī šufaγ ‘to thresh’, šufaγ, šupta ‘be angry’; IE Pok. 625 kseubh-, O.Ind. kṣobh-, kṣubh-; Slav. Pol. chybać ‘move to and fro’ (variants -bh- and -p-),

[DKS] ‘movement, behaviour’, K 4, 142r3 <pra>cīga-saṃbuddhānu ākhośä dyāñätemä ‘I showed the behaviour of the pratyeka-saṃbuddhas’, Tib. spyod-lam ( = BS īryāpatha-). See khauś- ‘agitate’, Ⅴ 340, 80r5 ākṣutte khauśä ‘began to move’, BS G 37, 75a7 vāta-kṣobhena, verbal khauśā’ña, akhauṣṭa-, khoys- ‘move’.

[DKS] ‘covering, layer’, Ⅲ 90. 196 śī pau hīye ājve ‘the layers of the white onion’. From ā-juvā- or ā-judā-, base gau-: gu- or gaud-: gud- ‘cover’. For gau- note Waxī gaw-：gott- ‘to cover’, infinitive gīn ‘to cover’, prigīn ‘horse-cloth’; Sarīkolī parwein ‘horse-cloth’, parway-: parwid ‘to cover’. For gaud-, see uysgun-.

[DKS] ‘covered’, Ⅲ 38.41 spyakyau ājsava ‘covered with flowers’, = Ⅲ 40.17 spyakyau ājsävä, = Ⅲ 47.62 spyakyau ājsavä. From ā with ǰata- ‘put, strike’, or čata- from kan- ‘cover’ (see kangā-). See also najsata-, nijsava- ‘covered, set with’, ājsan-.
[DKS] ‘they deck’, Ⅲ 43.21 ālagāryau jsa śaikä aṃga ājsänīdä ‘they deck well the limbs with ornaments (BS alaṃkāra-Y. Base ǰan- or čan- ‘to cover’. See ājsava-.

[DKS] ‘with bonds’, Manj. 204 hṣaṇy(au) ājsyau jsa pabasta nāsākū aysmva pāja ‘bound by momentary bonds the receiver in fact (-ū) is the individual mind’. From base arg- or ark- ‘to restrict, confine, restrain’ see cognates s.v. ai,jsvā (loc. plur.) ‘bonds’. Instead of kṣaṇya a reading kūṇḍa was printed.
[DKS] ‘is to be seated’, K 8, 306, 5r3 ramaṃdai āñä ‘must sit delighted’. See āh- ‘to sit’.

[DKS] ‘flour’, Sid. 133r1, Tib. phye, Sid. 142 VI ārä (-r- for -ḍ-), BS śaktu-; 2nd component Sid. 143r2 rrūsāḍä ‘barley flour’, Ⅲ 85.76; 86.87 rüsādä, in phrase Ⅱ 23.19.2 rruśi jsa āḍi. Base ar- ‘to grind’ see ārr- ‘to grind’. For ‘flour’, the participle ā-rta-, -ka-, here āḍa- (either *arəta- or ā-rta-), Zor.P., Yaγn. ārt, N.Pers. ārd, Pašto ōṛə masc. plur., Wazīrī Pašto ǟṛə ‘dough’, Yidγa yāṛë, yōrəy (*ārtaka-), Šuγnī yāuγǰ, Sarikolī yoγǰ, yowǰ, Sanglēčī wuḷōk, Parāčī wâṛun (*ārtana-). O.Ind. aṭṭa-, Hindī āṭā, Kroraina aṭa, from *alta- (T. Burrow, BSOAS 35, 1972, 539).

[DKS] ‘flour’, Sid. 134V2 mau jsa āḍe jsa grauśe, padīmāñä ‘a paste is to be made from mau-liquor, from flour’, BS snigdhā madyena śaktavaḥ, Tib. čhaŋ hol-kon-gyi skyo- mar byas-pahi naŋ-du (skyo-ma ‘pap, paste, dough’) ed. Pekin 216a3-4. To āḍa-.

[DKS] ‘more wild, raging around’, Ⅲ 70.120 ādara makala hamāre ‘the monkeys are more wild’ (when they fail to find Sītā though under threat of the pulling out of their eyes); K 65, 83r4 bayastām jsīmau āḍarau vaska ‘for the fear-filled ghosts (jsīmaa- =BS preta-), more wild, (may I get āryāvalokiteśvara’s power)’. Parallel to K 64, 8IV3 ttyā vaską harbäśą dūkha bauḍa īnīme, cū vā ṣai jsīmā āräḍa bayista ‘for those may I be able to bear all woes, even those who are ghosts, wild, fear-filled’. Hence āḍara- from *āra-tara- (if not changed from āraḍa-) to Sogd. ”r’k *āraka- ‘mad’, Av. ara-, Oss. ärra ‘wild, mad’, see also arājsa, arā-bū. But āraḍa-, āräḍa- is the later form of ārragäḍa- ‘evil-doing, guilty’.
[DKS] ‘other’, loc. sing. K 45.22 āḍāña ysītha ‘in another birth’, with secondary ā- from a-, see aḍara, aḍāra- other ’.
[DKS] ‘sitting’, SuvO. 56v6 dharma-bhānānu vätä āṇānu hā ttä vara tsuñau, BS dharma-āsana-gatānām antikam upasaṃkrameyuḥ. See āh-.
[DKS] (āṃṇaka?), Sid. 17r3 ‘quail-like bird’, BS vartīra-, Tib. hur-pa, possibly named ‘reddish’ as a colour name from *āṣṇa-, *ārṣṇa- to *ā-raxšna-, with rrāṣa-, N.Pers. raxš.

[DKS] ‘being in’, BS -vihārin-, Ⅲ 23, 18b2 jau-nisāmä āṇadā ‘being free from strife’, (gen. plural) BS araṇā- vihāriṇāṃ-, ibid.
